He was thirsty, so he took a drink from the well. After drinking, the little boy felt so happy. He started running around the well, feeling so adventurous. But, he didn't notice that it got dark. He was feeling lost and ashamed.Suddenly, he saw a bright light. It was his mom! She had been looking for him for so long and was so relieved to see him. She hugged him and said, â€œNo more running off!â€ The little boy hugged his mom back and promised to stay at home. The little boy was so happy to be home. He learned his lesson and never ran away from home again.
Summary: A little boy ran away from home to explore the world, but got lost and scared as it got dark. His mother found him and took him home, where he promised to never run away again, happy to be safe and sound.
Story: Once there was a big bear walking through the woods. He was looking for oxygen because he was feeling very tired. He was walking and walking, but he could not find any oxygen. Then, he saw a very big tree and he climbed up it. Once he reached the top he began to breathe in the fresh oxygen and he was very glad. He stayed up there for a while and enjoyed the fresh air. Then, he went back down the tree and continued walking through the woods. Finally, he reached a big fountain and he was filled with joy. From then on, the bear visited the fountain each day to take in the oxygen from the bubbly water.
Summary: A big bear was tired and searched for oxygen in the woods, climbing a tree to breathe in fresh air when he found a fountain, where he visited each day to take in oxygen from the bubbly water. The bear was filled with joy and continued to visit the fountain daily.
Story: Tom was a shy boy who did not like to talk to other kids. He liked to play with his toys in his room and read books with his mom. He had a big teddy bear that he hugged every night. He called him Raz, because he had a razor on his nose. His mom said it was a button, but Tom liked to pretend it was a razor.One day, Tom's mom said they had to go to the doctor. Tom did not want to go. He was scared of the doctor. He said he was not sick. His mom said it was just a check-up and it would not hurt. She said he could bring Raz with him. Tom agreed, but he was still nervous.At the doctor's office, Tom held Raz tightly. He saw other kids waiting with their moms and dads. Some of them were crying, some of them were laughing. Tom did not say anything. He just looked at the floor. His mom said his name and they went inside. The doctor was a nice lady who smiled at Tom. She asked him some questions, but Tom did not answer. He just nodded or shook his head. The doctor said she wanted to look at his ears, his eyes, his mouth and his nose. She took out a small light and a stick. Tom did not like the light. He closed his eyes. He did not like the stick. He opened his mouth. He did not like the doctor touching his nose. He trembled.The doctor said, "What's this?" She pointed at Raz's razor. Tom said, "It's a razor." The doctor said, "Can I see it?" Tom said, "No." He hugged Raz harder. The doctor said, "Don't worry, I won't take it away. I just want to look at it. It's very shiny and pretty. Can I touch it?" Tom said, "No." He trembled more.The doctor said, "Okay, okay, I won't touch it. But can you tell me why you like it so much? Does it make you feel brave?" Tom said, "Yes." The doctor said, "That's good. You know, you are very brave too. You came to the doctor and you let me check you. That's not easy for a shy boy like you. You should be proud of yourself." Tom said, "Really?" The doctor said, "Really. And you know what? I have something for you. A sticker. You can choose any one you like. They are all very shiny and pretty too." Tom said, "Really?" The doctor said, "Really. Come on, let's go and see." She took Tom's hand and led him to a table with many stickers. Tom saw one that looked like a razor. He smiled. He let go of Raz and reached for the sticker. He put it on his nose. He said, "Look, mom, I have a razor too." His mom said, "You do, honey. You look very brave." The doctor said, "You are very brave, Tom. And very smart. And very kind. And very handsome. And very shy. And that's okay. You are a wonderful boy." Tom said, "Thank you, doctor." He hugged Raz and his mom. He did not tremble anymore. He was happy.
Summary: Tom, a shy boy, was afraid of the doctor but brought his teddy bear, Raz, for comfort. The doctor was kind and gentle, and Tom eventually opened up to her, sharing his love for Raz and feeling proud of his bravery.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a big boat. It had a tall pole with a flag on top. The boat could sail on the sea and go very fast. The boat was very popular and many people liked to ride on it.One day, the boat sailed to a small island. On the island, there was a big spring. The water was very clear and tasted very good. The boat stopped at the island and the people drank from the spring. They liked it very much.After drinking from the spring, the boat sailed back home. The people talked about how much they liked the spring and the boat. They told their friends to ride on the boat and drink from the spring. The boat became even more popular and many people wanted to ride on it.
Summary: A big boat with a tall pole and flag sailed on the sea and went fast, popular among passengers who drank from a clear and tasty spring on a small island it visited. After drinking from the spring, the boat returned home, and its popularity increased as passengers told their friends to ride on it and drink from the spring.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw pictures with her crayons. One day, she drew a picture of her thumb, which was her favorite body part. Her mom saw the picture and said, "Wow, Lily! That's an original drawing! Can I hang it on the fridge?" Lily was happy and said, "Yes, please let me see!" Her mom smiled and let her see the picture on the fridge. Lily was so proud of her drawing and showed it to everyone who came to visit. One day, Lily's friend came over and saw the picture. She said, "I wish I could draw like you, Lily!" Lily smiled and said, "I can teach you! Let's draw together!" They sat down with their crayons and drew pictures of their thumbs together. It was a fun and original activity that they both enjoyed.
Summary: Lily, a little girl who loves to draw with her crayons, creates a picture of her favorite body part, her thumb. Her mother admires the drawing and hangs it on the fridge, making Lily proud and eager to show it off to others.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Tweety. Tweety had a big dream to fly high up in the sky. One day, Tweety saw a wide open window and decided to fly inside. But Tweety didn't know that the window was in a big house.Suddenly, Tweety heard a loud thunder sound. It was so scary! Tweety tried to escape, but the window was too high. Then, a little girl saw Tweety and said, "Don't be afraid little bird, I will help you escape!"The little girl opened the window and Tweety flew away safely. Tweety was so happy and said, "Thank you, little girl! I will never forget how you helped me escape from the thunder."
Summary: Tweety, a little bird with a dream to fly high, entered a big house through an open window but became scared when he heard thunder. A kind little girl helped Tweety escape by opening the window, allowing him to fly away safely.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a gray cat named Mittens. One day, Lily and Mittens went on a picnic. They brought a fork to eat their yummy food. But, the fork was not attached to the basket and fell on the ground. Lily picked up the fork and attached it to the basket with a clip. Mittens meowed happily and they continued their picnic. The end.
Summary: Lily and her gray cat Mittens went on a picnic and brought a fork to eat their food, but it fell on the ground. Lily picked up the fork and attached it to the basket with a clip, and Mittens meowed happily as they continued their picnic.
Story: Once upon a time, in a small forest, there was a dull pine tree. The tree was sad because it was not as pretty as the other trees. Its branches were not as green and its needles were not as long. The other trees had fun and played all day, but the dull pine tree felt left out.One day, a friendly squirrel saw the dull pine tree and wanted to help. The squirrel had an idea to repair the tree and make it happy again. The squirrel called all its friends to gather colorful leaves and flowers from the forest.Together, the animals worked hard to repair the dull pine tree. They put the colorful leaves and flowers on the tree's branches. The tree was very happy and felt pretty like the other trees. Now, the dull pine tree was not dull anymore and it played with the other trees every day. The forest was full of joy and everyone lived happily ever after.
Summary: A dull pine tree in a small forest felt left out because it was not as pretty as the other trees, so a friendly squirrel came up with a plan to repair it by gathering colorful leaves and flowers from the forest and decorating its branches. The tree was transformed and was no longer dull, and it played with the other trees every day, filling the forest with joy.
Story: Peter and his mother were driving in the car. Peter asked his mom, "Where are we going?" His mother smiled and said, "We are going to get your license!" Peter asked, "What's a license?" His mother answered, "It's like a special card that will let you do lots of things!"When they arrived at the office, Peter saw a chubby man in there. He waved to Peter and asked him some questions. He asked Peter what color his favorite ice cream was. Peter answered "Strawberry!" The man smiled and gave Peter a big hug.Peter and his mother went to a room and filled out some paper work, and then Peter went to get his picture taken. Once he was done, the chubby man gave Peter his license! Peter couldn't believe it! His mom said, "Now that you have your license, you can do all sorts of things!" Peter was so happy, he knew his life would change now that he had a license. He thanked the chubby man as he and his mom left the office.
Summary: Peter and his mother went to an office to get Peter his driver's license, where he met a chubby man who asked him questions and gave him a big hug after taking his picture. With his new license, Peter is now able to do many things he couldn't do before, and he is excited for the new opportunities that come with it.
Story: Mummy and Daddy had a big box. Daddy grabbed a chair and unpack the box. Mummy took out a big book. She opened it and saw lots of pictures of different colours. "Look," said Mummy. She started pointing to the pictures. "What colour is this one?"The child looked carefully. "Red!" she said. Mummy smiled. She gave the little girl some matches and said, "Can you match the bad pictures with the right ones?"The little girl worked hard, but eventually she matched all the pictures correctly. Mummy praised her. "What a clever girl!" she said.Mummy and Daddy put away the big box and the book. They gave the little girl a special hug. The little girl was so happy. She had done a great job unpack and matching the pictures.
Summary: Mummy and Daddy had a big box, and Daddy unpacked it while Mummy showed the little girl a book with colorful pictures. The little girl matched the pictures with the corresponding ones in the book, and Mummy praised her for being a clever girl.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat popcorn while watching her favorite movie. One day, she asked her mom to make her some popcorn. Her mom said yes and started making it. But while her mom was making the popcorn, she slipped on a wet spot on the floor and spilled the popcorn all over the kitchen. Lily was sad because she really wanted to eat popcorn. Her mom was grateful that she didn't get hurt and they both cleaned up the mess together. Lily's mom promised to make her more popcorn once the floor was dry. In the end, they were both happy and enjoyed their movie with a big bowl of popcorn.
Summary: Lily wanted popcorn while watching her favorite movie, but her mom slipped and spilled the popcorn all over the kitchen. Despite the mishap, Lily's mom promised to make her more popcorn once the floor was dry, and they both cleaned up the mess together, ending up happy and enjoying their movie with a big bowl of popcorn.
Story: Once there was a purple arm. It belonged to a little three-year-old girl. Every morning, the girl would hug her arm and tell it she loved it very much.One day, the girl decided to give her purple arm away. She thought of a friend who she knew was unhappy and was sure her arm would make her smile.The girl found her friend and thought she looked sad. She bent down and said, 'I'm giving this to you â€“ it's my purple arm.'Her friend smiled and said, 'But I need both my arms.'The girl thought for a moment and then said, 'No, this arm is for you to give away to someone else when you see someone who needs it. It's like a hug from me to you.' The girl smiled, feeling happy that she had done something nice for her friend.Her friend hugged her and said, 'That's a very kind thing to do. I'll make sure to give it away when I can.'And with that little girl learned an important lesson â€“ by giving away something special we can show someone that we care.
Summary: A little girl had a purple arm that she hugged and told she loved every morning. One day, she decided to give it away to a friend who looked sad, teaching her an important lesson about giving away something special to show someone we care.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to play with his toys all day long. One day, Timmy's mommy took him to a modern toy store. There were so many toys to choose from! Timmy was so happy that he wanted to spend all his money on toys.As they were walking around the store, Timmy saw a sparkly toy car. He really wanted it, but he didn't have enough money left to buy it. Timmy felt sad and disappointed, but his mommy told him that they could come back another day and buy it when they had more money.Timmy learned that it's important to save money and not spend it all at once. He also learned that sometimes we have to wait to get what we want, just like waiting to buy the sparkly toy car.
Summary: Timmy went to a toy store with his mommy and saw many toys he wanted to buy, but he didn't have enough money. His mommy told him to save money and come back another day to buy the sparkly toy car he wanted.
Story: Once upon a time, a little boy named Timmy went to pick some grapes from his garden. He saw a slow worm crawling on the ground and said, "Hello Mr. Slow Worm, do you want to come pick grapes with me?"The slow worm replied, "No thank you, I am too slow to keep up with you. But can you whistle for me when you find the juiciest grape?"Timmy agreed and went to pick grapes. He found a big juicy grape and whistled for the slow worm. The slow worm came over and said, "Wow, that grape looks delicious! Can I have a bite?"Timmy gave the slow worm a small piece of the grape and they both enjoyed it together. From that day on, whenever Timmy went to pick grapes, he would whistle for the slow worm and they would share a grape together.
Summary: Timmy, a little boy, invites a slow worm to join him in picking grapes from his garden. The slow worm declines but asks Timmy to whistle when he finds a juicy grape, which Timmy agrees to do, and they share a bite of the grape together.
Story: Sam and Tom are brothers. They like to play with their cars and trucks. They have many tools to fix them when they break. One day, they find a big hill near their house. They want to see how fast their cars and trucks can go down the hill."Let's have a race!" Sam says. He picks his red car. Tom picks his blue truck. They put their toys at the top of the hill and get ready to push them."Ready, set, go!" Tom says. They push their toys and watch them speed down the hill. The car and the truck go very fast. They make loud noises. Sam and Tom run after them.But the hill is too steep. The car and the truck go out of control. They hit a rock and flip over. They break into pieces. Sam and Tom are scared. They stop running and look at their toys."Oh no!" Sam says. "Our car and truck are broken! What will we do?""Don't cry, Sam," Tom says. "We have tools. We can fix them. Come on, let's go get them."Sam and Tom go to the bottom of the hill. They pick up the pieces of their car and truck. They take them back to their house. They use their tools to put them back together. They are happy. They hug their toys."Next time, let's not race on the hill," Sam says."OK," Tom says. "Let's race on the grass. It's safer and softer."They laugh and play with their car and truck on the grass. They are not scared anymore. They have fun.
Summary: Sam and Tom, brothers who enjoy playing with their cars and trucks, decide to race them down a big hill near their house. However, the hill is too steep and their toys go out of control, breaking into pieces.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a happy dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play in the park with his friends. One day, Spot saw his friend Max jogging around the park. Max was very fast and Spot wanted to be fast too. So, Spot started to jog too.While jogging, Spot saw a big onion on the ground. He sniffed it and thought it smelled funny. Spot didn't like onions, they made his tummy feel funny. So, he left the onion alone and kept jogging.After jogging for a while, Spot saw his owner waving at him from across the park. Spot was so proud of himself for jogging and being a good boy. He ran over to his owner and wagged his tail happily. From that day on, Spot loved to jog and make his owner proud. The end.
Summary: Spot, a happy dog, enjoyed playing and running in the park with his friends. However, when he saw his friend Max jogging, he became interested in jogging too and started to follow him, even though he didn't like the smell of an onion he found on the ground.
Story: Anna liked to draw with pastels. She had many colors of pastels in a big box. She drew flowers, animals, and houses with them. She was very good at drawing and her drawings were charming.One day, Anna wanted to draw in her room. She took her box of pastels and went upstairs. She saw that her brother Tom was playing with his cars in the hall. She did not like Tom. He was mean and noisy. He sometimes broke her things and made fun of her drawings.Anna did not want Tom to bother her. She went into her room and locked the door. She put her box of pastels on the floor and started to draw. She was happy and quiet.Tom saw that Anna locked the door. He was angry and curious. He wanted to see what she was doing. He knocked on the door and shouted. "Anna, open the door! Let me see your drawings! I want to play with your pastels!"Anna ignored him. She did not want to open the door. She did not want to share her pastels. She did not want to play with Tom. She kept drawing and humming.Tom was very angry and bored. He decided to do something bad. He went to the kitchen and got a match. He came back to the hall and lit the match. He threw the match at Anna's door. The door caught fire. The fire spread quickly. The hall was full of smoke and flames.Anna smelled the smoke and saw the fire. She was scared and screamed. She tried to open the door, but it was locked. She could not get out. She could not reach her pastels. She could not call for help. She cried and cried.Tom ran away. He did not help Anna. He did not tell anyone. He was selfish and cruel.The fire burned the house. Anna and her pastels were gone. No one saw her charming drawings. No one heard her happy humming. No one saved her. It was a bad ending.
Summary: Anna was a talented young artist who enjoyed drawing with pastels, but her brother Tom's mean behavior and disregard for her safety led to a tragic ending when he set fire to her room, destroying her artwork and causing her to perish in the flames. Despite her talent and happiness, Anna's life was cut short by Tom's cruel actions.
Story: Once upon a time there was a little girl called May. May was very tired and wanted a nap.So she grabbed her teddy bear and went outside. She found a pretty stream at the side of the forest. May was happy and started to play in the stream. The water was cold and it made May shiver.Then May got more and more tired. She slowly put her head down to try and get some rest. But then she heard a noise, it was a big bear!May got scared and shivered even more. She held onto her teddy bear tight and quickly ran away from the stream. She ran home and was very happy to be safe.May was so tired that she went straight to bed. She snuggled up with her teddy bear and soon fell asleep.
Summary: May, a little girl, was tired and went outside to take a nap by a stream. She played in the cold water, but then heard a big bear and ran home, holding onto her teddy bear for comfort.
Story: Tom and Mia like to play with their bikes in the park. They have fun riding on the paths and making noises with their bells. One day, they see a big boy with a new bike. His bike has four wheels, not two. He rides very fast and does not look where he is going."Wow, look at his bike!" Tom says. "It has so many wheels!""I want to try it!" Mia says. "Maybe he will let us have a turn."They run after the big boy and ask him nicely. "Hello, can we please try your bike? It looks very fun."The big boy stops and looks at them. He has a mean face and a loud voice. He says, "No, you can't. This is my bike and I don't share. Go away, you little pests. You have your own bikes."He is very rude to Tom and Mia. He makes them feel sad and angry. He does not care about their feelings. He only cares about his bike.Tom and Mia do not like the big boy. They think he is selfish and mean. They decide to play with their bikes and ignore him. They say, "We don't need his bike. Our bikes are better. We have fun with our bikes and we share with our friends. He can keep his bike and be alone."They ride away and find their friends. They have a good time playing with their bikes and their friends. They are happy and kind. They forget about the big boy and his bike.
Summary: Tom and Mia enjoy playing with their bikes in the park until they encounter a mean boy who refuses to share his new bike with them. The boy is selfish and rude, making Tom and Mia feel sad and angry, so they decide to play with their own bikes and ignore him instead.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a planet called Zog. It was an unusual planet because it had purple clouds and green grass. The sun would rise every morning and the creatures on Zog would wake up and play.One day, a big spaceship came to Zog. The creatures were scared and ran to hide. The spaceship had come to take over the planet. The creatures tried to fight back, but they were too small and weak.The spaceship took control of Zog and the creatures were forced to leave their homes. They traveled through space to find a new planet to live on. But they never found one as beautiful as Zog. They were sad and missed their planet with the purple clouds and green grass.
Summary: On the planet Zog, creatures played and lived in a world with purple clouds and green grass. However, a big spaceship arrived and took over the planet, forcing the creatures to flee and search for a new home.
Story: Once upon a time there were two little friends. The first was called Sam and the second was called Joe. Sam and Joe were best friends and were always together.One day, Joe asked Sam for help. He wanted to make a waffle. Sam said he would support Joe.They quickly got to work making the waffle. Sam stirred the mixture, Joe cut the apples and they both shared the job. When it came to sharing the waffle, Sam said it should be fair. Joe agreed.So, each friend had half a waffle and a half apple. They both took some photos to remember the moment.They both smiled at each other, happy with the idea of being supported, having all they needed, and being fair to each other. The end.
Summary: Sam and Joe were best friends who worked together to make a waffle, sharing the task and the waffle equally. They took photos to remember the moment and were happy with their fairness and friendship.
Story: Anna liked to repeat what her big sister said. She thought it was fun to copy her words and sounds. Sometimes her sister got mad and told her to stop, but Anna did not listen.One day, they went to the park with their mom. Anna saw a big dog and pointed at it. "Look, a dog!" she said. Her sister said, "That's a German shepherd. It's a smart and strong dog." Anna repeated, "German shepherd. Smart and strong dog."The dog's owner heard Anna and smiled. He came over and said, "Hello, little girl. Do you like my dog?" Anna repeated, "Hello, little girl. Do you like my dog?" The owner laughed and said, "You're very cute. What's your name?" Anna repeated, "You're very cute. What's your name?"Her sister felt embarrassed. She said, "Sorry, sir. She likes to repeat everything. Her name is Anna. I'm Lily." The owner said, "That's okay. I don't mind. My name is Tom. And this is Rex." He petted his dog and said, "Rex, say hello to Anna and Lily." Rex barked and wagged his tail.Anna was surprised. She said, "Rex, hello!" Rex barked again. Anna repeated, "Rex, hello!" Rex barked again. Anna laughed and clapped her hands. She said, "Rex, repeat!" Rex barked again. Anna said, "Rex, repeat!" Rex barked again.Her sister smiled and said, "Anna, you found a new friend. Rex likes to repeat, too." Her mom said, "That's very nice. But we have to go now. Say goodbye to Tom and Rex." Anna said, "Goodbye, Tom and Rex!" Rex barked and licked her face. Anna giggled and hugged him. She said, "Rex, repeat!" Rex barked and licked her face again.The end.
Summary: Anna, a young girl, likes to repeat words and sounds, often copying her big sister. At the park, she meets a man and his dog, Rex, and excitedly repeats everything he says, making the man and his dog happy.
Story: Sara and Ben are playing with their toys in the living room. Sara likes to organize her toys by color and shape. She puts the red cars in one pile, the blue balls in another, and the yellow blocks in a third. Ben likes to mix his toys and make them do funny things. He puts the green dinosaur on top of the pink doll, the orange truck under the purple hat, and the brown seat on his head."Ben, stop messing up my toys!" Sara says. "They have to be organized!""Why?" Ben asks. "It's more fun to make them silly!""No, it's not! It's messy and wrong!" Sara says. She tries to take the brown seat from Ben's head, but he holds on to it."Give it back! It's mine!" Ben says. He pulls the brown seat away from Sara, but she doesn't let go.They tug and tug, until the brown seat rips in half. They both gasp and drop the pieces."Look what you did!" Sara cries. "You broke my brown seat!""Sorry, sorry!" Ben says. "I didn't mean to!"They both feel sad and sorry. They look at their toys, and see how different they are."Maybe we can play together, but with different toys," Sara says."OK," Ben says. "You can have the red cars, and I can have the green dinosaur."They smile and hug. They pick up their toys and start to play again. They learn to share and respect each other's ways of playing. They are happy.
Summary: Sara and Ben are playing with their toys in the living room, but Sara wants to organize them by color and shape, while Ben likes to mix them up and make them do funny things. Despite their differences, they learn to share and respect each other's ways of playing and find happiness together.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a big, big city. It was enormous! There was a little girl who lived in the city. She wanted to go to the park, but her mommy said no.The little girl was sad. She didn't understand why she couldn't go to the park. She decided to request her mommy to let her go. But her mommy still said no.The little girl didn't know what to do. She wanted to go to the park so badly. She thought and thought, and finally came up with an idea. She would draw a picture of the park and show it to her mommy. Maybe then her mommy would say yes.The little girl drew a beautiful picture of the park. She showed it to her mommy and requested again. This time, her mommy said yes! The little girl was so happy. She went to the park and had a wonderful time.
Summary: A little girl lived in a big city and wanted to go to the park, but her mommy said no. The little girl was sad and came up with an idea to draw a picture of the park to show her mommy and ask again, which finally worked.
Story: Tom and Lily are playing with their toys on the floor. They have cars, dolls, blocks and books. They make noises and stories with their toys. They are having fun.But then, Mom comes in and says, "Kids, it's time to eat. Come to the table, please." She has a big plate of food in her hands. It smells good.Tom and Lily do not want to stop playing. They say, "No, Mom, we want to play more. We are not hungry." They keep playing with their toys.Mom is not happy. She says, "Kids, you have to listen to me. You need to eat to grow big and strong. The food will get cold if you wait too long. Come to the table, now."Tom and Lily still do not want to go. They say, "No, Mom, we don't like the food. It looks tough and yucky. We want something else."Mom is very angry. She says, "Kids, that's enough. The food is not tough and yucky. It is tasty and healthy. You have to eat what I make for you. You are being very rude and naughty. Come to the table, or you will have no dessert."Tom and Lily are scared of Mom's angry voice. They do not want to have no dessert. They want to have cake or ice cream. They decide to listen to Mom and go to the table. They put their toys away and sit on their chairs. They say, "Sorry, Mom, we will eat the food. We will be good."Mom smiles and says, "Thank you, kids, for listening to me. I love you. Now, let's eat and enjoy the food. And maybe, if you finish your plates, you can have some dessert."
Summary: Tom and Lily are playing with their toys when their mom tells them it's time to eat. They don't want to stop playing and try to negotiate, but their mom is insistent and they eventually go to the table, where they are rewarded with dessert if they finish their meal.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a tall hill. On top of the hill lived a big, kind bear named Ben. Ben liked to play with his friends, the little rabbits.One sunny day, Ben and the rabbits were playing a game. "Let's play hide and seek," said Ben. "I will count, and you all hide. Then, I will find you." The rabbits hopped away to find good hiding spots. Ben closed his eyes and started counting.Ben looked for the rabbits all over the hill. He found some of them hiding behind trees and in the tall grass. But there was one rabbit, named Rosie, who was very good at hiding. Ben searched and searched, but he could not find her."Rosie, I give up," Ben called out. "I surrender! You are the best at hiding." Rosie giggled and came out from her hiding spot. She was hiding in a hole under a big rock.From that day on, Ben and the rabbits played hide and seek all the time. They knew that Rosie was the best at hiding, but they still had lots of fun trying to find her. And they all lived happily on the tall hill.
Summary: Ben, a big, kind bear, lived on top of a hill and played hide and seek with his friends, the little rabbits. Despite Ben's best efforts, one rabbit named Rosie was very good at hiding and he could not find her, so he declared her the winner and they all continued to play together happily.
Story: Anna and Ben like to play dress up. They have many clothes and hats and shoes to try on. They pretend to be different people and animals and have fun.One day, they find a big box in the garage. It is full of old things that mom and dad do not use. They see a shiny badge, a black hat, a blue shirt and pants, and a pair of handcuffs. They think they are police things."Let's play police and robbers!" Anna says. She puts on the badge and the hat and the shirt and pants. She looks like a real police. Ben takes the handcuffs and says, "I will be the robber. I will steal the cookies from the kitchen."They run to the kitchen and Ben grabs a handful of cookies. Anna chases him and says, "Stop, robber! You are under arrest!" She catches him and puts the handcuffs on his wrists. She says, "You are going to jail. Come with me."She leads him to the closet and opens the door. She pushes him inside and says, "This is your jail. You have to stay here until you say sorry." She closes the door and locks it with a key. She says, "Be quiet, robber. No talking, no singing, no noise."Ben does not like the jail. It is dark and small and boring. He wants to get out and play. He says, "Anna, please let me out. I am sorry. I will not steal cookies again." But Anna does not hear him. She is busy playing with the other clothes and hats and shoes. She forgets about Ben.Ben cries and cries. He is scared and sad. He wishes Anna would remember him and let him out. He hopes mom and dad will come soon and find him. He thinks playing dress up is not fun anymore.
Summary: Anna and Ben play dress-up and use old items they find in the garage to pretend to be police and robbers. Anna locks Ben in a closet as "jail" but forgets about him, causing Ben to cry and feel scared and sad.
Story: Once upon a time, there lived a boy who was very brave. His name was John. Whenever something mysterious happened, John was always the first to try and solve it.One day, John was playing around his home when the most mysterious thing happened. One of John's toys vanished right in front of him! John was so surprised, he couldn't stop looking at the spot where it had been.John's mom saw what had happened and said, "John, don't worry, the toy must have just gone somewhere else. Let's go find it!"So John and his mom searched all around the house, but the toy was nowhere to be found. John was so sad.Suddenly, his mom smiled and said, "John, I know where the toy went. Come with me!"John followed his mom to the backyard, and in the corner, he saw his toy! John couldn't believe it! The toy hadn't vanished after all, it had just gone somewhere else! John was so relieved.From that day on, John was sure to always keep his toys in a safe and secure place. That way, they would never vanish again!
Summary: John, a brave boy, was surprised when one of his toys vanished in front of him. His mom found the toy in the backyard, revealing that it had not actually disappeared, but had only moved to a different location.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little mouse who lived in a small house. One day, the mouse went out to find some cheese to eat. While walking, the mouse met a cat who asked, "Can I help you find some cheese?" The mouse said yes and they walked together.But, the mouse was not careful and lost its way. The cat said, "Don't worry, little mouse. I will help you find your way back home." Finally, they found the mouse's house and the cat said goodbye.The mouse was very happy and said, "Thank you, cat. You are not a poor cat, you are a kind cat." The cat smiled and said, "I am happy to help you, little mouse." From that day on, the mouse and the cat became good friends.
Summary: A little mouse got lost while searching for cheese and met a cat who offered to help him find his way home. The cat helped the mouse find his house and the mouse thanked the cat for his kindness, and they became good friends.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a cheap stack of blocks. Every day, the stack of blocks would disappear. The little boy who owned the stack of blocks was very sad. He wanted to play with his blocks, but they were always gone.One day, the little boy decided to figure out why his blocks were disappearing. He watched the stack of blocks very carefully. After a few minutes he saw something! A sneaky mouse was taking them away!The little boy was angry at the mouse. He shouted, "Take your own blocks!" Suddenly, the mouse ran away and never came back.From that day onwards, the little boy's stack of blocks never disappeared again. He was very happy, so he played with them until it was time for bed. The end!
Summary: A little boy's stack of blocks kept disappearing, causing him great sadness. After observing the situation, he discovered a mischievous mouse was taking his blocks away, and he shouted at the mouse to leave his toys alone, causing the mouse to never return.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved strawberries. They were her favorite food in the world. One day, Lily went to the store with her mommy and saw a delicate strawberry plant. She asked her mommy if they could take it home and plant it in their garden. Her mommy said yes.Lily learned how to take care of the strawberry plant. She watered it every day and made sure it had enough sun. The plant grew big and strong, and soon there were lots of strawberries. Lily was so happy.But one day, when Lily went outside to check on her plant, she saw that all the strawberries were gone. She looked closer and saw that a naughty little animal had eaten them all. Lily was very sad. She had learned how to take care of her plant, but she had not learned how to protect it from animals.
Summary: Lily, a little girl who loves strawberries, asks her mommy to buy a strawberry plant for their garden. With daily care and attention, the plant grows and produces many strawberries, making Lily happy. However, a naughty animal eats all the strawberries, teaching Lily the importance of protecting her plants from unwanted visitors.
Story: Once upon a time there was a bus. It was a yellow bus. The bus was very special because it was the first bus ever made. One day, the bus was ready to go on a special trip. It was the bus' very first trip. The bus driver set off on the road. He drove around the neighbourhood. Everyone cheered and waved at the bus as it drove by. The bus went higher and higher. It went over hills, through valleys, and even through rivers. The bus driver was brave and he felt happy that he was driving the yellow bus. After a long ride, the bus reached its destination. Everyone jumped off the bus and cheered. The driver was so proud of his yellow bus and set it off for the next adventure. The end.
Summary: A yellow bus, the first ever made, went on its first trip, driven by a brave bus driver who took it on a long ride through hills, valleys, and rivers, ending at its destination where everyone cheered and jumped off. The bus driver was proud of his yellow bus and set it off for its next adventure.
Story: Lily and Ben like to play with paint. They have many colors of paint in small bottles. They also have paper, brushes and a big cloth. They put the cloth on the floor and spread it out. Then they put the paper on the cloth and open the bottles of paint.They dip their brushes in the paint and make pictures on the paper. They use red, blue, yellow, green and purple. They have fun mixing the colors and making shapes. They laugh and talk as they paint.But then, Lily sees something bad. One of the bottles of paint has a leak. The paint is dripping out of the bottle and onto the cloth. The cloth is getting wet and dirty. Lily says, "Oh no! The paint is leaking! We have to stop it!"She grabs the bottle and tries to close it. But the paint is slippery and the bottle is hard to hold. She drops the bottle and it rolls on the cloth. More paint comes out and makes a big mess. The cloth is covered with paint. Lily and Ben are covered with paint too.They look at each other and say, "Uh oh! We made a big mess! We have to clean it up!" They get some water and some towels and try to clean the paint. But the paint is sticky and hard to remove. They rub and scrub and wipe and rinse. They work hard to make the cloth and themselves clean again. They are tired and sorry. They say, "We are sorry we made a mess. We will be more careful next time."
Summary: Lily and Ben enjoy painting together, using various colors and shapes, but their fun is interrupted when one of the paint bottles leaks, making a big mess on the cloth and covering them both in paint. After trying to clean up the mess with water and towels, they realize that the paint is sticky and hard to remove, and they are left feeling tired and sorry for making a mess.
Story: Once there was a little girl named Poppy. She loved to explore the outdoors and look for different things. One day, Poppy saw a bee buzzing around a wild poppy flower. It was the prettiest flower she had ever seen! Poppy smiled and decided to pluck it for herself. Just as she was about to touch it, the bee suddenly snapped at her! She quickly stepped back and watched as the bee flew away.Poppy decided to pick the poppy flower anyway. She gently touched it and it felt so soft and smelled sweet. Poppy was so excited to take it home - she had never seen such a beautiful flower before. She carefully put it in her pocket and started skipping back home. Along the way, she stopped to smell the flower and think about all the wonderful things she could do with it.When Poppy arrived home, she excitedly pulled the poppy out of her pocket. She held it up in front of her face and took a big sniff. It smelled so sweet! She smiled and then quickly went to show her mom what she had found. Her mom was so proud of Poppy and gave her a big hug.That night, Poppy placed the poppy in a special spot on her nightstand where she could look at it every day. It always made her feel so happy, so she named it her "happy poppy".
Summary: Poppy, a curious little girl, found a beautiful wild poppy flower and decided to pick it, but a bee snapped at her just as she was about to touch it. Despite the scare, Poppy still decided to pick the flower and took it home, where she admired its softness and sweet smell, and kept it in a special spot to look at every day, naming it her "happy poppy."
Story: Tom and Lily were playing in the park with their mom. They liked to slide, swing and run on the grass. Mom watched them and smiled. She had a big bag with her. Inside the bag, there was a new dress for her. It was expensive and pretty. She wanted to wear it for a special dinner with dad."Mom, can we have a snack?" Lily asked. She was hungry and thirsty."Sure, sweetie. Let me get you some juice and cookies from the bag," mom said. She opened the bag and looked inside. But the dress was not there. She gasped. "Oh no! Where is my dress?"Tom and Lily ran to her. They saw the empty bag. They were confused."Mom, what's wrong?" Tom asked."Someone took my dress. It was in the bag, but now it's gone. It vanished!" mom said. She was sad and angry."Who took it, mom?" Lily asked."I don't know, honey. Maybe a bad woman saw it and wanted it for herself. She was sneaky and grabbed it when I was not looking," mom said."That's not fair, mom. That's your dress. You paid for it. It's expensive," Tom said."I know, Tom. But I don't think we can find it now. It's too late. The woman is probably far away," mom said.She hugged Tom and Lily. She tried to cheer up. She still had her children and her husband. They were more important than a dress."Come on, let's go home. Maybe dad can help us. He's smart and kind. He will make us feel better," mom said."OK, mom. We love you. And we love dad too," Tom and Lily said.They left the park. They hoped the bad woman would feel sorry and return the dress. But they did not count on it. They learned a lesson. They had to be careful with their things. And they had to be grateful for their family. They were the best things they had.
Summary: Mom was playing with her kids in the park when someone took her new dress without her permission. The kids were confused and sad when they realized the dress was gone, and their mom was upset and disappointed.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy who loved his favorite mug. It was blue and had a picture of a dog on it. Timmy would drink his milk every day from the mug. One day, Timmy's little sister, Lily, wanted to drink from the mug too. But Timmy said, "No, Lily! This is my mug. You can't use it."Lily got very upset and started to cry. She said, "I want to drink from the mug too!" Timmy didn't want to share his mug, so he got angry and tore a piece of paper. This made Lily even more upset. She said, "Timmy, that was bad! You shouldn't tear things when you're angry."Timmy felt sorry for what he did and hugged Lily. He said, "I'm sorry, Lily. You can drink from the mug too." From that day on, Timmy and Lily shared the mug and they never tore anything again.
Summary: Timmy loved his favorite blue mug with a picture of a dog, but his little sister Lily wanted to drink from it too. Timmy initially refused to share the mug, but after tearing a piece of paper in anger, he apologized and allowed Lily to drink from it as well.
Story: Mum and Dad were very happy.  They loved each other and their little baby. When the baby was born, it was the happiest day! But soon they realised the baby was different. They were ignorant of the differences and didn't know what to do.Mum was so worried. She had never heard of what the baby had - she felt so helpless. But Dad had faith. He loved their little baby, and they both knew they had to learn and grow together.He reached out to others who shared the same problem, and soon they all knew how to help their baby. With loving care, their little one grew into a happy, healthy child.Mum and Dad's love for their child was so strong. They worked so hard together to make sure the baby was happy and healthy. They were the best parents ever!
Summary: Mum and Dad were overjoyed when their baby was born, but soon realized the baby was different and didn't know how to handle it. Despite their ignorance, Dad had faith and reached out to others for help, and with loving care, their baby grew into a happy and healthy child.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat soup with her spoon. One day, Lily's spoon broke and she felt sad. She went to her mommy and said, "Mommy, my spoon is broken. Can you help me?"Her mommy said, "Of course, Lily. I will support you and we will find a new spoon together." They went to the store and looked for a new spoon. It was hard to find one that Lily liked, but her mommy was persistent and they finally found the perfect one.Lily was so happy with her new spoon and said, "Thank you, Mommy. You're the best!" Her mommy smiled and said, "I will always support you, Lily." From that day on, Lily used her new spoon every day and remembered how her mommy helped her find it.
Summary: Lily, a little girl, was sad when her spoon broke, but her mommy helped her find a new one. With her new spoon, Lily was happy and thanked her mommy for supporting her, and her mommy was happy to help.
Story: Once upon a time there was a very important fairy. Her name was Boots and she had the most important job of all fairies. Every day Boots flew around her special forest and included lots of wonderful things to make it happy.One day, Boots was flying around her forest when she heard a little voice calling for her help. She followed the sound and found a three year old child named Lizzy."Can you help me, Fairy Boots?" asked Lizzy.Boots smiled and gave her a hug. "Of course I will help you, Lizzy. What do you need?""I am trying to find a fairy," Lizzy said. "I need a fairy to help me do something very important."Boots smiled again and said, "Well, you have come to the right place! I am a very important fairy and I would be happy to help you."And so, Boots and Lizzy worked together to do something very important. They included lots of magic and love to make their dreams come true. When they were finished, they celebrated in the most special way they could think of.In the end, Boots and Lizzy were both very happy and learned an important lesson: that helping others and including magic can make any dream come true!
Summary: Boots, a very important fairy, helps a three-year-old child named Lizzy by including lots of magic and love to make her dreams come true. Through their collaboration, Boots and Lizzy learn that helping others and including magic can make any dream come true, leaving them both happy and fulfilled.
Story: The sun was shining brightly in the sky as Sally and her mommy walked together through the park. Suddenly, Sally stopped in her tracks. She saw a cherry tree with bright red cherries hanging from its branches. Sally stared in awe, wide-eyed and mesmerized. "Oh look, Mommy! Cherry!" she said excitedly. "Yes, that's right," her mommy answered. "Those cherries look delicious. But we can't grab them because they don't belong to us. That cherry tree belongs to someone else."Sally listened carefully. She thought about the cherries for a few moments and then continued walking. As they passed a house near the park, Sally noticed a small fountain in the garden. She knew immediately that it was her own. "Mommy, my cherry tree!" she shouted happily."That's right," Mommy replied, pride and joy in her eyes. "That cherry tree belongs to you. You must remember to be respectful of things that don't belong to you and not be too bossy when it comes to taking things which are not yours."Sally smiled and nodded her head, understanding her mommy's words and feeling proud of her own cherry tree. She knew it was a valuable life lesson that she would remember forever.
Summary: Sally and her mommy walked through the park, admiring the cherry tree with its bright red cherries. Sally was excited to see her own cherry tree in a nearby garden, and her mommy taught her the importance of respecting things that don't belong to her and being mindful of taking only what is hers.
Story: Once there was a strong little girl named Emma. She loved to explore and one day, she decided to climb up to the roof of her house. Emma was so adventurous. She carefully climbed higher and higher, until finally she was on the roof of her house. As she looked around, she noticed something she had never seen before. It was a magical little key at the edge of the roof."What could the key open?" Emma thought to herself. She decided to turn it in the door to see what it could do. As soon as she got the key in the door, it opened up and revealed a secret room with lots of surprises!Emma was so excited! She went in and saw all sorts of magical things. There were toys, games and treats all over the place. Emma couldn't believe how amazing the secret room was. She had a great time exploring and learning about all the magical things!When it was time to go, Emma knew she had to be strong. She gathered her courage and carefully climbed down from the roof. Emma was proud of herself for being brave and exploring something new. She will never forget the magical secret room she found on the roof.
Summary: Emma, a curious and adventurous little girl, climbed to the roof of her house and discovered a magical key that opened a secret room filled with surprises. Emma explored the room, finding toys, games, and treats, and was proud of herself for being brave and discovering something new.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the big green park. One day, Timmy saw a giant tree in the distance. He wanted to see it up close, so he started to walk towards it. But the tree was very long away, and Timmy felt tired. Suddenly, Timmy saw his friend Billy running towards him. Billy asked Timmy why he looked so sad. Timmy told Billy about the giant tree and how he couldn't reach it. Billy smiled and said, "Don't worry, Timmy. We can reach it together!" So, Timmy and Billy held hands and walked towards the giant tree. They walked and walked, and finally, they reached the tree. Timmy was so happy that he hugged Billy. The moral of the story is that when you have a friend, you can reach anything you want, even a giant tree that seems too long away.
Summary: Timmy wanted to see a giant tree in the distance but felt too tired to reach it, until his friend Billy came to help him and they reached the tree together, proving that with a friend's help, anything is possible. The story teaches the moral that friends can help you achieve your goals and make even the impossible possible.
Story: Tim and Lily are playing with their dog, Max. Max is big and has brown fur. He likes to run and jump and lick their faces. Tim and Lily laugh and hug him.But then, Max sees a cat outside the window. He barks and runs to the door. He wants to chase the cat. Tim and Lily try to stop him. They hold his collar and say, "No, Max, stay!"Max is strong and pulls hard. He makes Tim and Lily struggle. They fall on the floor and get messy. Max runs out of the door and after the cat.Tim and Lily are sad and angry. They get up and brush their clothes. They look at the door and hope Max will come back soon.They hear a noise. It is Max. He is back. He has a scratch on his nose and dirt on his fur. He looks sorry. He wags his tail and whines.Tim and Lily are happy and relieved. They forgive Max and hug him. They say, "We love you, Max, but don't chase cats again!"They take Max inside and clean his nose and fur. They give him a treat and a toy. They play with him and make him happy. They are a good family.
Summary: Tim and Lily are playing with their big, brown dog Max when he sees a cat outside and runs after it, pulling them along. Despite their efforts to stop him, Max manages to escape and chase the cat, causing them to fall and get messy.

He hopped in and sailed off into the sky. High, high, high he flew until all he could see was bright sunshine. Then he rested in the warm, blue sky for a while. He watched the world below, watching people doing their daily tasks. Eventually, he decided it was time to come back down to the ground. Although he was sad to leave his new sky home, he had to go back to life on the ground. But, with a smile on his face, he knew heâ€™d have plenty of time to rest in the sky again soon!
Summary: A little boy wanted to fly, so he searched for an airplane and found a light, wispy structure. He hopped in and flew high into the sky, watching the world below until he decided it was time to come back down to the ground, but with a smile on his face and the knowledge that he would have more opportunities to fly again soon.
Story: Tommy and Sarah were best friends. Every day they would play together and that made Tommy happy and Sarah jealous. One day Tommy was spinning around the table in the playground."Hey Sarah, let's spin together!" Tommy said smiling. But Sarah just scowled. "No! I don't want to spin," she replied.But Tommy wouldn't give up. He kept spinning faster and faster around the table until finally he lost his balance and fell off the table. Sarah laughed and said, "Hah! Serving you right, Tommy!" Tommy was so angry he got up and ran away, never to play with Sarah again.
Summary: Tommy and Sarah were best friends, but one day Tommy's spinning around a table made Sarah jealous. Tommy continued to spin despite Sarah's refusal to join him, but he lost his balance and fell off the table, which made Sarah laugh and mock him.
Story: Once there was a three year old girl named Kayla. Every day, Kayla woke up and prayed. She prayed to God for things like food and friends.One day, Kayla went outside and saw a little dog. She ran over to him and called him Mr. Dog. She asked if he wanted to be her friend.The dog was very modest, so he said no. He said he had things to do and couldn't stay.Kayla was sad and started to cry. She said, "Please stay and be my friend Mr. Dog."But the dog said no again. He said he had to go.Kayla was very sad, but she understood and let the dog go. She said goodbye, and watched him run away. She said another prayer and thanked God for bringing Mr. Dog into her life, even if just for a little while.
Summary: Kayla, a three-year-old girl, prayed to God every day and one day met a dog named Mr. Dog who refused her friendship despite her repeated requests. Despite the dog's refusal, Kayla remained polite and thanked God for the brief encounter.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the market with her mom. One day, while they were walking, they saw a man who looked troubled. Lily's mom asked the man, "Are you okay?" The man didn't reply at first, but then he said, "No, I lost my wallet and I don't know what to do." Lily's mom felt bad for the man and wanted to help him. She said, "Let's go to the market and see if anyone found your wallet." At the market, they asked around and finally someone had found the man's wallet. He was so happy and replied, "Thank you so much! You are so kind." Lily was happy that they could help the man and she learned that it's always good to help others when they are in trouble.
Summary: Lily, a little girl, went to the market with her mom and saw a man who looked troubled. When her mom asked him if he was okay, the man revealed that he had lost his wallet and was worried about what to do.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a dad and his daughter, who both loved to cook together. They had a dishwasher to help them. One day, the dishwasher stopped working. Dad was sad and so was the daughter. The daughter said to her father, "Can you please restore our dishwasher, Dad?" Dad hopped on the internet and looked for a way to restore the dishwasher.He found a distant expert, who could come and help him the next day. The expert arrived the next day and fixed the dishwasher. Dad and the daughter were very happy and hugged each other. They thanked the expert and started cooking again. The end!

Story: Once there was a little girl who wanted to play with her toys. But her mommy said, "No, not yet. First, I need to measure something."The little girl was very curious. She watched as her mommy opened an envelope. Inside was a tape measure. She watched as her mommy measured around the room.Afterwards the little girl asked, "What did you measure?" Her mommy said, "I had to measure, to make sure it was the same all the way around."The little girl didn't understand all the measuring, but she knew it was important. Her mommy said, "If I don't measure, it could turn out terrible!"So the little girl decided that measuring must be an important thing to do. She asked her mommy if she could help measure too, and her mommy said yes! The little girl was so happy, and she and her mommy had lots of fun measuring together.

Story: It was a gloomy night and Marianne was feeling scared. She shivered under her blankets and tried to settle down and get to sleep. But then a loud noise startled her and she whimpered.Mommy came in and saw Marianne was scared. She gave her a hug and said "It is okay, nothing is going to hurt you. You can settle down and go back to sleep." Mommy sat by Marianne's bed and sang her a soft lullaby. After a while Marianne felt soothed and sleepy. She closed her eyes and snuggled into her pillow. Finally, Marianne settled down and Mommy said goodnight. With Mommy by her side, Marianne felt safe enough to sleep. The next morning Marianne woke up refreshed and ready for the day. She smiled and thought about how nice it was to finally settle down after such a gloomy night.
Summary: Marianne was scared and shivered under her blankets on a gloomy night, but after a loud noise startled her, her mom came in and gave her a hug, reassuring her that nothing was going to hurt her. With her mom's comfort, Marianne felt safe enough to settle down and go back to sleep, and she woke up the next morning feeling refreshed and ready for the day.
Story: Once upon a time there was a girl named Anna. She loved her family very much and liked to help them at home. One day, Anna heard the loud sound of an ambulance siren. She quickly ran outside to take a look.When Anna saw the ambulance, she felt scared. She heard her mother's voice calling out to her, "It's ok Anna, it's not coming for us." Anna looked up at her mother and asked, "What is it doing?" Her mother replied, "The ambulance is helping someone who needs it."Anna watched with admiration as the hard ambulance raced up the street in a hurry. She could see how much the driver and the doctors loved helping people who were in need.Anna realized that when somebody needed help it was important to do your best to give them a hand. She wanted to help too and decided to always be ready in case she could support the doctors and the ambulance crew.
Summary: Anna, a young girl, witnesses an ambulance racing up the street and becomes curious about its purpose. She learns that the ambulance is helping someone in need and decides to always be ready to support the doctors and ambulance crew if she can.
Story: Once upon a time there were two friends, Trey and Dave. Trey had the best gear ever and was really proud of it. Dave felt jealous of Trey's gear. So Dave got some new gear of his own. He was very excited to show it off to Trey. But Trey didn't seem as impressed as Dave was hoping. Trey said, "Hey Dave! That's nice, but my gear is way better. It can do way more things. Why don't you try out my gear?" Trey was very kind and served up his gear to Dave.Dave was feeling much better with Trey's gear and the two of them had tons of fun. From then on, Trey and Dave shared their gear and never felt jealous of each other.

Story: Once upon a time, there lived a lamb in a grassy meadow. The lamb loved spending time with its friends, hopping around and playing games.One day, the lamb saw something rising in the sky. It was smoke! That looked frightening! The lamb's friends were scared and ran away, but the lamb decided to take a closer look.When the lamb got closer, it found out the smoke was coming from a big, loud machine. The lamb was so frightened that it couldn't move! But then, it heard a kind voice coming from inside the machine. The voice said, "It's okay, lamb, I just need to take a smoke break and then I'll be right back." The lamb was relieved to hear the kind voice and was soon back to its happy self, running around and playing with its friends. It promised itself never to be too scared to take a close look at something new.
Summary: A lamb lived in a grassy meadow and enjoyed playing with its friends, but one day it saw smoke rising in the sky and became frightened. However, after hearing a kind voice from inside the machine, the lamb realized it was nothing to be afraid of and returned to its happy self, playing with its friends once again.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a lovely dress that she loved to wear. One day, she went to the store with her mom to buy some candy.While they were walking, Lily saw a toy she wanted. She asked her mom if they could buy it, but her mom said no. Lily got upset and started to cry.Her mom hugged her and said, "The truth is we don't have enough money to buy the toy right now. But we can save up and come back to the store another day."Lily stopped crying and smiled. She was happy that her mom told her the truth. They bought their candy and went home, but Lily couldn't wait to come back to the store and buy her toy.

Story: Anna likes to help her mom in the kitchen. Mom makes pastry for pies and cakes. She gives Anna some dough to play with. Anna rolls the dough and cuts out shapes with cookie cutters. She makes stars, hearts, circles and squares.Mom puts the pastry shapes on a baking tray and puts them in the oven. She tells Anna to sort the shapes into different piles. Anna thinks this is a fun game. She makes a pile of stars, a pile of hearts, a pile of circles and a pile of squares. She counts how many shapes she has in each pile.The oven makes a ding sound. Mom takes out the baking tray and puts it on the counter. The pastry shapes are golden and smell yummy. Mom lets them cool down a bit and then gives Anna a plate. She tells Anna to pick one shape of each kind and put them on the plate. Anna does as she is told. She picks a star, a heart, a circle and a square. She looks at her plate and smiles. She has made a bright and tasty snack. She thanks her mom and takes a bite of the star. It is crispy and sweet. She loves pastry.
Summary: Anna helps her mom make pastry for pies and cakes, and afterward, she sorts and counts the shapes as they come out of the oven. Anna picks one of each shape (star, heart, circle, and square) and puts them on a plate, then takes a bite of the star, enjoying the crispy and sweet taste.
Story: Lily and Tom were playing with their toys in the garden. Lily had a big hippo that she loved very much. Tom had a small car that he liked to zoom around. Lily wanted to show Tom how smart her hippo was. She said, "Look, Tom, my hippo can tie a knot with his tail. Can your car do that?"Tom looked at Lily's hippo and saw that it had a long, thin tail. He thought that Lily was lying. He said, "No, Lily, your hippo cannot tie a knot. You are making it up. Your hippo is ignorant. He does not know anything."Lily felt angry and hurt. She said, "No, Tom, you are wrong. My hippo is very clever. He can do many things. You are ignorant. You do not know anything."Tom felt angry and hurt too. He said, "No, Lily, you are wrong. My car is very fast. It can do many things. You are ignorant. You do not know anything."Lily and Tom started to shout at each other. They did not want to play together anymore. They turned away from each other and hugged their toys.Their mother heard them and came to the garden. She saw that they were fighting and asked them what was wrong. They told her what they had said to each other. Their mother shook her head and said, "Lily, Tom, you are both being silly. Your hippo and your car are both nice toys. They can do different things. But they cannot talk or think. They are not ignorant. They are just toys. You are ignorant. You do not know how to share and be kind."Lily and Tom felt ashamed. They realized that their mother was right. They said sorry to each other and to their mother. They decided to play together again. They took turns to play with the hippo and the car. They learned how to tie a knot with the hippo's tail and how to zoom the car around. They had fun and were happy.
Summary: Lily and Tom were playing in the garden when they started arguing over their toys, with Lily insisting that her hippo could tie a knot and Tom claiming that his car was faster. Their mother intervened and explained that toys are just toys and cannot think or talk, and that they should learn to share and be kind to each other.
Story: Sara was a little girl. She was three years old and very curious. She was poking a stick at the ground and humming a little song. Then she looked up and saw an ice-cream truck.Sara was so happy that she started running and poking at the truck. She thought it looked very yummy. Unfortunately, the truck driver was very angry. He told Sara that poking at his truck was very stupid.Sara started to cry, but the driver didn't care. He said that she was not allowed to have any ice-cream and drove away. Sara was so sad that she went home and cried. She never got her ice-cream, and she learned her lesson to never poke at something again.
Summary: Sara, a curious 3-year-old, was excited to see an ice cream truck but was scolded by the driver for poking at it, making her sad and teaching her a lesson about not touching things without permission. Despite her disappointment, Sara went home and cried, never to poke at anything again.

We're going to the park today!" Timmy smiled and clapped his hands.At the park, Timmy saw a big slide and wanted to go down it. His mom said, "I'll catch you at the bottom, don't worry." Timmy climbed up the ladder and slid down the slide. He had so much fun! When he got to the bottom, his mom caught him and said, "You're so brave, Timmy!"After playing at the park, Timmy and his mom went home. Timmy was tired, so he went back to his orange crib and fell asleep. As he slept, he dreamed about going down the big slide again. The end.

Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the park. One day, she was playing on the swings when her friend Timmy came over."Hi Lily, do you want to play with me?" asked Timmy."Yes, let's play!" said Lily.They played together for a while, but then Timmy noticed the sunset. "Look Lily, the sunset is so pretty!" he said.Lily looked up and saw the orange and pink sky. "Wow, it's so beautiful!" she said.But then, a noisy truck drove by and interrupted their view. "That truck is so loud," said Timmy.Lily agreed and said, "Let's go sit on the bench over there where it's quieter."They went to the bench and watched the sunset together, enjoying the peaceful moment.
