Story: Nicky was sad, he wanted to play with his friends. But his parents did not permit it. They said he was too little.So Nicky decided to take a walk down the street by himself. He saw the beautiful yellow flowers and a distant bird flying away. He wanted to follow it. Even though his parents said no, Nicky thought it would be okay to follow it a little bit.He started walking and walking because the bird flew very far away. But soon, Nicky became lost. He didn't know which way to go. He started to cry, but no one heard him. Nicky was very scared and then he fell asleep. When he woke up, he still didn't know which way to go. He started to cry again. Finally, an officer found him and took him back home. His parents were very happy to see him, but they were also very angry because he had gone away. Nicky learned his lesson, but it was too late.
Summary: Nicky wanted to play with his friends but his parents wouldn't let him, so he decided to take a walk by himself. Despite his parents' warnings, Nicky followed a bird he saw flying away, but he became lost and scared, and eventually an officer found him and took him back home.
Story: One day, a little girl named Jill went outside to play. She had a toy car with her and she decided to rock back and forth on it. She had so much fun doing it! Just then, her dad came to see what she was doing. He said, "Jill, you look serious when you rock the car. Don't rock it too hard on either side."Jill said, "Okay, Daddy!" She made sure to be gentle and slow when she rocked the car back and forth. After a while, her dad smiled and said, "Good job, sweetheart. You took my advice seriously!" Jill smiled and she continued to rock the car. She enjoyed playing while spending time with her dad.
Summary: Jill went outside to play with her toy car and enjoyed rocking it back and forth, but her dad reminded her to be gentle and not rock it too hard. Jill took her dad's advice seriously and continued to play while spending time with him.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a stable full of horses. The horses were all happy living together. But one day, a storm came and caused one of the stable walls to collapse. All the horses curiously looked at the broken wall and one of them, called Daisy, stuck her head out.Suddenly, Daisy saw a fragile bird hanging from a tree branch nearby. The little bird was chirping sadly and Daisy knew that she had to help it.Daisy reached out her neck and stretched it as far as she could. She tried to grab the bird but it was too far away. Daisy looked around and noticed a long rope hanging from a hook. She grabbed it in her teeth and managed to pull the bird closer.Daisy then grabbed the bird in her mouth, pushed it gently with her nose, and brought it back inside the stable. Everyone in the stable cheered when they saw Daisy bringing the bird back safe and sound!The bird thanked Daisy with a soft chirp and Daisy smiled. Daisy had saved the day.
Summary: In a stable full of horses, Daisy the horse saw a bird stuck in a tree after a storm and used her long neck and rope to rescue it, bringing it back safe and sound. The bird thanked Daisy with a chirp, and Daisy smiled, proud of her heroic act.
Story: There was one octopus who always wanted to dance. But, no one ever wanted to dance with him. He was so frustrated. One day, he asked a little girl if she wanted to dance with him. She was only three, but she said yes!They twirled and spun around the room. The octopus laughed and smiled as the girl showed him all kinds of new moves. When they were done, the octopus thanked her. He said, "Thank you for dancing with me. I had so much fun!"The little girl smiled and said, "You're welcome. I like to dance too!" Then, the octopus was so happy he did a jig.The little girl laughed, and so did the octopus. He was so happy to have found a new friend to dance with him, no matter how small she was. He knew they would be dancing together again soon!
Summary: An octopus named Ollie wanted to dance but no one wanted to dance with him, so he asked a little girl if she wanted to dance with him. The little girl, who was only three, happily agreed and they twirled and spun around the room, making the octopus very happy.
Story: Once upon a time, there was an alert cat. She was always awake, looking around and listening. One day, she noticed something. It was wheat! The cat wanted to eat it, so she came close. She smelled it and saw that it was fresh. The cat was so happy! She started eating the wheat and purring. She ate and ate until there was no wheat left. When she finished, she was full and happy. She looked all around - it was so quiet. Then the cat noticed something else - the door was still open! She had to make sure it was closed so she wouldn't get in trouble with her owner. So the alert cat jumped up and shut the door. Now the cat was sure that no one would bother her or her wheat!
Summary: An alert cat noticed wheat and was excited to eat it, so she came closer to investigate and ate it until there was none left. After finishing, she noticed the door was still open and jumped up to close it to avoid getting in trouble with her owner.
Story: There was a little girl named Jane. She was three years old. She loved to watch things. One day Jane was in her room, and she saw something very cute. It was a curtain!The curtain was very colorful with circles, stars and flowers on it. Jane thought it was so cute. She watched it for a long time. She loved the way the colors and shapes moved when the wind blew.Suddenly, something unexpected happened. The curtain flew off the window! Jane was so surprised that she clapped her hands. She smiled and watched it fly all around the room.Finally, the curtain landed back on the window. Jane was so happy that she hugged it. She said, "Good curtain. You are so cute!" Then Jane went off to play. She was still happy about the flying curtain.
Summary: Jane, a 3-year-old girl, was fascinated by a colorful curtain with circles, stars, and flowers on her window. When the curtain unexpectedly flew off the window, Jane was surprised and delighted, clapping her hands and hugging it after it landed back in its place.
Story: Lila and Sam were at the zoo with their mom. They liked to see the animals and learn their names. They saw lions, monkeys, giraffes and many more. But their favorite animal was the elephant.The elephant was big and gray. It had a long nose and big ears. It could make loud noises and spray water. Lila and Sam wanted to feed the elephant some peanuts. They asked their mom if they could."Sure, you can feed the elephant, but be careful. The elephant is very hungry and might grab your hand with its nose," mom said.Lila and Sam took some peanuts from a bucket and walked to the fence. They saw the elephant waiting for them. It looked happy and curious. Lila and Sam held out their hands with the peanuts."Hello, elephant. We have some peanuts for you. Do you want some?" Lila said.The elephant nodded its head and reached out its nose. It took the peanuts from Lila's hand gently and put them in its mouth. It made a crunching sound and smiled."Thank you, elephant. You are very nice," Lila said.The elephant nodded again and looked at Sam. Sam had more peanuts in his hand. He was about to give them to the elephant, when he saw something else. He saw a pool of water behind the elephant. It looked cool and fun."Hey, look, Lila. The elephant has a pool. Do you think it can dive?" Sam said.Lila looked at the pool and wondered. She had seen people dive in the water, but not an elephant."I don't know, Sam. Maybe it can. Maybe it can't. Why don't you ask it?" Lila said.Sam thought that was a good idea. He asked the elephant."Hey, elephant. Can you dive in the water? Can you show us?" Sam said.The elephant heard Sam's question and thought for a moment. It liked the water and liked to play. It decided to show Sam and Lila what it could do. It nodded its head and walked to the pool. It took a deep breath and lifted its nose. Then it ran and jumped into the water. It made a big splash and disappeared under the water.Lila and Sam gasped and clapped their hands. They were amazed and excited. They waited for the elephant to come back up. They saw bubbles and waves in the water. Then they saw the elephant's nose and ears. The elephant came back up and sprayed water from its nose. It looked happy and proud."Wow, elephant. You can dive. You are very cool," Sam said.The elephant nodded and smiled. It thanked Sam and Lila for the peanuts and the fun. It asked them if they wanted to join it in the water."Sorry, elephant. We can't dive with you. We don't have swimsuits. But we can watch you and cheer for you," Lila said.The elephant understood and nodded. It said goodbye to Lila and Sam and went back to the pool. It dived and splashed and had a good time. Lila and Sam watched and cheered and had a good time too. They liked the elephant very much. They decided to come back to the zoo and see it again.
Summary: Lila and Sam visited the zoo with their mom and enjoyed seeing the animals, but their favorite was the elephant. They fed it peanuts and the elephant showed them its diving skills in the pool.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a naughty boy called Joe. He was very rude to everyone around him. One day, Joe found a big boot in the park. He wanted to keep it, but he couldn't carry it home. He thought and thought, and then he had an idea. Joe took off his scarf and used it to wrap up the boot. He tied the scarf tight around the boot so it wouldn't fall apart. Joe ran back to his house with the boot wrapped up in his scarf. He put it away safely in his room.From then on Joe was very happy with his wrapped up boot. He was much more polite and friendly too!
Summary: Joe, a naughty boy, found a big boot in the park and wanted to keep it but couldn't carry it home. So, he used his scarf to wrap it up and took it back to his house, where he stored it safely in his room, and from then on, he was much more polite and friendly.
Story: Lily and Tom were playing in the yard. They saw a big barrel near the fence. It was blue and round and had a lid on top."Let's open it and see what's inside," Lily said."OK," Tom said. They ran to the barrel and tried to lift the lid. It was heavy and stuck."Push harder," Lily said.They pushed and pushed until the lid popped off. Out came a lot of water and bubbles. They splashed on Lily and Tom and made them wet and cold."Wow, look at the bubbles!" Tom said. He tried to catch them with his hands.Lily laughed and blew some bubbles with her mouth.They had fun playing with the water and bubbles until they heard a loud voice."Hey, what are you doing with my barrel?" It was Mr. Brown, the neighbor. He was angry. He had a hose in his hand and was watering his flowers.He saw Lily and Tom and the water and bubbles all over his yard."That's my barrel of soap! I use it to wash my car! You made a big mess! Stop it right now!" He shouted.Lily and Tom were scared. They dropped the lid and ran away."Sorry, Mr. Brown!" They said.They went back to their house and told their mom what happened.She was not angry, but she said they had to say sorry to Mr. Brown and help him clean up.They nodded and went to get some towels.They learned not to play with things that are not theirs.
Summary: Lily and Tom were playing in the yard when they found a barrel near the fence. They tried to open it but it was heavy and stuck, so they pushed it until the lid popped off, releasing water and bubbles.
Story: Once upon a time there was a little boy called Tim. One day he found an old bracelet in the park. It was a very special bracelet with some writing on it. He couldn't read the writing though, so he took it home.When he got home Tim showed it to his mum. "Mum, look! I want to keep it."His mum said: "That's a very special bracelet Tim. Can you see the writing on it? Maybe it means something special."Tim looked closely. "It says 'sign here'". Mum said: "Maybe it's a birthday present from someone special."Tim was so excited. He said: "I'm going to sign it and keep it forever!" He grabbed a pen and signed the bracelet.That night, Tim proudly wore the bracelet to bed. The next morning, the bracelet was very dirty. Mum said: "Oh no! Now the writing is all smudged. Let's take it to the shop and get it cleaned up." But Tim said: "No! I like it just the way it is. It's special because it's my birthday bracelet." Mum smiled and said: "Alright then, Tim. We'll keep it together."
Summary: Tim found an old bracelet in the park with writing on it, which he couldn't read. He showed it to his mum, who suggested it might be a birthday present from someone special, and Tim was excited to keep it forever.
Story: Little Jack was walking in the park and he noticed something very interesting. He saw a big tree, full of leaves and birds singing on top of it. He wondered what it was and decided to find out.He walked closer to the tree and saw something very strange. It was a big round thing with holes in it. He had never seen anything like it before. He decided to touch it, and it felt hard. He picked it up and it was heavy. He then noticed that it smelled like cheese. He had smelled cheese before and it reminded him of the cheese his mom sometimes put on his sandwiches. Jack was so curious about this round thing. He had never seen something like it before. He looked for a sign to tell him what it was, but he couldn't find one. He knew this must be something very special, even though it looked quite ordinary.Jack took the round thing home and showed it to his mom. She smiled and said that it was something called a cheese wheel. She also said that it was probably very expensive. Jack smiled and said that he was glad he had found it.
Summary: Little Jack discovered a mysterious round thing in a park, which he had never seen before. He brought it home and showed it to his mom, who identified it as a cheese wheel, which she said was probably expensive.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mary. Mary loved to watch the musicians because they were so fun! She had never been to a musician show before and she was feeling a bit uncomfortable. So her mom took her hand to comfort her.Mary watched the musicians as they sang their songs and played their instruments. She couldn't believe how fun they were making it look. Then, the musicians asked everyone to clap their hands and sing along.Mary was so excited to be part of the musician show! She clapped and sang along, feeling much less uncomfortable. She even danced along with the musicians, which made everyone laugh. It was so much fun!After the show was over, Mary was so happy that she had watched the musicians. She was glad her mom had helped her to feel better so she could enjoy the show. She promised herself she would always watch the musicians whenever she had the chance.
Summary: Mary, a little girl, was uncomfortable at her first musician show but her mom's comfort helped her enjoy the performance. Mary clapped and sang along with the musicians, even dancing along, and had a great time.
Story: Once upon a time, in a big red barn, there lived a happy cow named Molly. Molly liked to play with her friends, the chickens and the pigs. They would run around the barn and have lots of fun. The barn was a warm and mild place to live.One day, Molly wanted to go outside and play, but her mommy did not permit her. "Why can't I go outside, Mommy?" Molly asked. Her mommy said, "It is not safe outside today. You can play inside the barn with your friends."Molly was sad, but she listened to her mommy. She played with her friends inside the barn. They had a great time playing games and laughing. Molly learned that it is important to listen to her mommy because she knows what is best for her. And they all lived happily ever after.
Summary: Molly, a happy cow, lived in a big red barn with her friends the chickens and pigs. Despite wanting to go outside and play, Molly's mommy didn't permit her to go out due to safety concerns, so she played with her friends inside the barn instead.
Story: Once upon a time there was a big, strong lion. He liked to roar. He roared very loudly and could make thunder shake.One day, he decided to take a journey to space. He spread his wings and flew away. But rockets were not friendly to him. They kept making him go forward.Then a big friendly bird came to help him. He had very flexible feathers, and he flew towards the lion. He helped the lion fly to space without getting blocked by the rockets.When they finally got there, the lion was so excited he roared louder than ever! He was so happy.The lion and the bird both stuck together and explored the amazing space around them. They had lots of fun together!
Summary: A big, strong lion wanted to travel to space, but rockets kept pushing him forward. A friendly bird with flexible feathers helped the lion reach space by flying towards him and carrying him there without getting blocked by the rockets.
Story: Once there was a great aeroplane. It was so big that it could fly all around the world! It was even bigger than a mountain.The aeroplane flew very high in the sky. But one day, it had to make an emergency landing because of a broken wing. Everyone on the aeroplane was very afraid.Fortunately, there was a friendly man who had the power to heal things. He waved his hands in the air, and the broken wing healed with a big puff of magical smoke! Everyone was very happy and the aeroplane flew higher and higher with its great wings.The friendly man had saved the day and everyone on the aeroplane cheered. They all waved goodbye as the aeroplane flew off into the sky and they thanked the man for his magical healing powers.
Summary: A large aeroplane flew around the world, but had to make an emergency landing after a wing broke. A friendly man with magical powers healed the wing with a puff of smoke, allowing the aeroplane to fly again and everyone on board to be safe.

The little girl loved the dress so much that she sighed whenever she saw it in the store window. One day, she wished upon the stars for the dress. On the way home, her parents stopped at a store. Inside, the girl saw that same beautiful green dress! She was so happy she started to jump. Her parents purchased the dress for her as a surprise gift.The girl hugged her parents and put on the dress. She sighed with joy and twirled around in it. She wore it everywhere, twirling and feeling like a princess. She was so happy to finally have her favorite dress!

She painted until her fingers were very sore.When she was finished, the little girl showed the present to her friends. They all clapped and cheered. The little girl was very proud.The little girl took the present to her mom. Her mom was so happy that she gave her a big hug. The little girl was so excited!After that, the little girl felt very hungry. She ate all sorts of yummy things. Before she knew it, she was full and happy. The end.

Story: Mira and Sam are friends. They like to play together. One day, they decide to have a tea party. They find some cheap cups and plates in the garage. They fill them with water and pretend it is tea."Would you like some tea, Sam?" Mira asks."Yes, please, Mira. Thank you," Sam says.They sip their water and make polite noises. They feel very grown-up.But then, Mira's dog, Rex, comes running. He is dirty and wet. He jumps on the table and knocks over the cups and plates. The water spills everywhere. Mira and Sam scream."Rex, no! Bad dog!" Mira shouts."Go away, Rex! You ruined our tea party!" Sam cries.Rex barks and wags his tail. He thinks they are playing. He licks their faces and tries to grab their clothes.Mira's mom hears the noise and comes outside. She sees the mess and the wet children."Oh, dear. What happened here?" she asks."Rex happened, Mom. He is a naughty dog. He needs a bath," Mira says."I'm sorry, Mira. I'm sorry, Sam. Rex was supposed to stay in the yard. He must have escaped. Come on, Rex. Let's go bathe you," Mira's mom says.She takes Rex inside and turns on the faucet. Rex hates baths. He whines and tries to run away.Mira and Sam watch from the window. They giggle."Maybe we can have another tea party later," Mira says."Maybe. But next time, let's keep Rex away," Sam says.They agree and hug. They are still friends.
Summary: Mira and Sam have a tea party in the backyard, using cheap cups and plates they found in the garage. However, their fun is ruined when Mira's dog, Rex, comes running and knocks over their cups and plates, causing a mess.
Story: There was a house and two friends who lived in it. One was named Jack and the other was named Jill. One day, Jack and Jill were playing in the house when they heard a loud noise. They both looked up and saw a big tough man. He said, "I'm looking for the toughest kid around. Who's the toughest?" Jack and Jill looked at each other in surprise. Jack smiled and said, "I'm the toughest one here." The tough man looked at Jack carefully, then he laughed and said, "No, that's not true. I think Jill here is the toughest one."Jill smiled and said, "That's not true either. We're both tough." The tough man laughed even harder. He said, "You're both very tough. But I think you should joke around more often."Jack and Jill smiled. They both liked to joke. They played games and laughed for hours. They both agreed that being tough was great, but it was even better when you could joke about it.
Summary: Jack and Jill, two friends living in a house, were playing when a big tough man appeared and asked who was the toughest. After some banter, the man determined that both Jack and Jill were equally tough and enjoyed joking around together.
Story: Tom and Lily are young. They like to play in the park. They see a big crane. The crane is yellow and tall. It can lift heavy things."Wow, look at the crane!" Tom says. "It is so strong and cool!""I want to see it closer!" Lily says. "Can we go there?"Tom and Lily run to the crane. They see a man. The man is the crane driver. He wears a helmet and a vest."Hello, kids!" the man says. "Do you like the crane?""Yes, we do!" Tom and Lily say. "Can we sit in the crane?"The man smiles. He is nice. He says, "Sure, you can. But you have to be careful. The crane is not a toy. It is a tool."He helps Tom and Lily to sit in the crane. They wear helmets too. They feel excited. They can see the whole park from the crane.The man shows them how the crane works. He pushes some buttons and pulls some levers. The crane moves up and down, left and right. It makes a loud noise.Tom and Lily laugh. They have fun. They thank the man for letting them sit in the crane. They learn something new. They go back to their mom and dad. They tell them about the crane. They are happy.
Summary: Tom and Lily are young children who enjoy playing in the park, where they see a big yellow crane that can lift heavy objects. The crane driver, a kind man, allows them to sit in the crane and shows them how it works, teaching them about its capabilities and importance.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little boy who loved to dig holes in his back yard. One day, as he was digging and digging, he came across a beautiful, shiny red flower. It was amazing! He exclaimed, "Oh, look at the beautiful flower!"The little boy touched the petals of the flower, when suddenly a magical voice spoke out from underneath it. "Be gentle with the flower," said the voice. "Show it some kindness, and it will bloom."The little boy listened carefully, and he was amazed by the voice. He smiled, and promised to take care of the flower. Every morning, he watered it and plucked away the weeds that surrounded it. As the days went by, the flower slowly began to open, and it was soon blooming more and more with each passing day.The little boy was so proud of his work and felt a sense of accomplishment when he saw the bloom of the flower.The moral of the story is that being nice and gentle to others can have amazing rewards. When we show kindness, it can make us feel good, and great things can bloom from it.
Summary: A little boy discovered a hidden flower in his backyard and was instructed by a magical voice to be gentle and show kindness to it. By watering and weeding the flower daily, the boy watched it bloom and felt a sense of accomplishment and joy from his kind actions.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a great pool. Inside the pool lived a family of frogs. The frogs all wanted to be together and have fun. Every day, they would jump and play and chat. They laughed and sang and they were always happy. But then one day, the frogs noticed that the pool was getting smaller and smaller. They were worried and scared. They hoped that the pool would get bigger again. The next day, the frogs were amazed - the great pool was full and bigger than ever! The frogs cheered and thanked the sky. They were so happy that their pool was back. They spent the day playing and laughing and having fun together. The little frogs had hope and now knew that if you are brave enough to wish, your dreams will come true.
Summary: In a magical pool, a family of frogs lived and played together, but one day they noticed the pool shrinking. The next day, the pool miraculously expanded, restoring the frogs' joy and hope for the future.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a cute little girl named Lily. She had a cute face with rosy cheeks and big blue eyes. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends. She saw a cute puppy and wanted to pet it. But the puppy didn't like it and barked at her.Lily's friend, Timmy, said, "Don't poke the puppy, Lily. He doesn't like it."Lily said, "But I want to pet him. He's so cute."Timmy said, "Maybe he doesn't want to be poked. Let's play with the ball instead."Lily agreed and they played with the ball. They had so much fun that they forgot about the puppy. Later, they saw the puppy playing with his owner and wagging his tail. Lily said, "Look, the puppy is happy now. We didn't poke him."From that day on, Lily learned that it's important to be kind to animals and not poke them if they don't like it.
Summary: Lily, a curious and playful little girl, went to the park with her friend Timmy and saw a cute puppy. Despite Timmy's warning not to poke the puppy, Lily tried to pet it, but the puppy barked at her and she learned to be kind to animals and respect their boundaries.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a cheerful kangaroo. It happily hopped around the grassy fields all day. One day, the kangaroo had an idea. It wanted to remove the big rocks from the field. It collected all the rocks and began to push them away.The kangaroo had worked hard, but it was feeling tired so it decided to take a break. Just then, it heard a loud noise. The kangaroo looked up and saw a flock of birds. It hopped up to them and said "hello, can you help me with my task?" The birds were more than happy to help, so they chirped and began to remove the rocks.The kangaroo was so pleased with their help. Together, they managed to remove all the rocks from the field. The kangaroo was so grateful, it thanked the birds and hopped away. The birds all flew off, feeling cheerful that they had helped out the kangaroo.The end.
Summary: A cheerful kangaroo hopped around a field, collecting rocks and pushing them away. With the help of some friendly birds, the kangaroo was able to remove all the rocks from the field, and they all celebrated their success together.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a mitten named Mittens. Every day, Mittens would go outside to play with all his friends. One day, it was terribly cold and all the friends were too cold to go outside. But Mittens had a great idea.He called out to all of his friends, "Let's unite and share our mittens to keep us warm!" So, one by one all the friends shared their mittens and put them together to make one big mitten! It was wonderful and everyone was so grateful for Mittens' excellent plan.The friends stayed warm and played together for the whole day. And whenever it got too cold outside, they would always unite under the mitten shared by their friend Mittens.
Summary: Mittens, a mitten, came up with a clever plan to keep his cold friends warm by sharing their mittens together to make one big mitten. By working together, the friends stayed warm and played together for the whole day, and whenever it got too cold outside, they would huddle under the mitten shared by Mittens.

You can show it to your little brother and sister when we get home.â€ Little Luke was okay with that and the family went home. Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was only three. One day she was playing in her room when she found a herb. She was so excited to find something new! She pretended that the herb was a magic potion. She closed her eyes and used her imagination. "I'm the queen of the forest. I'm so impressive!" She said with a big smile. Just then, Lily heard her mother calling her. "Lily! Come here! I want to show you something special," said her mother. Lily put the herb back where she found it and ran off to see what her mother wanted. She was so excited! The end.

Story: Once upon a time there was a dog and a cat.They each had a special job. The dog's job was to bark when it heard bad noises, and the cat's job was to tap on the wall to give warnings.One day, something unusual happened. The dog barked to release a wild creature. It was so scared it ran away! Then the cat came and tapped on the wall. It was her way of saying it was time to help the creature.The two animals worked together to find the creature. They followed the sound of its delicate steps until they saw it hiding in a tight corner. The creature was so small and scared, but the animals knew they could help.The dog barked and the cat tapped and the creature came out of its hiding spot. Then they all noticed the animal was wearing a flexible collar, so they knew where it belonged. "Let's take it home," said the cats. "It'll be safe there."The dog and the cat helped the creature back to where it belonged. Even though it was small, it felt big and important with the two animals by its side.
Summary: A dog and a cat had special jobs to do, with the dog barking at bad noises and the cat tapping on walls for warnings. When an unusual event occurred, the dog barked to release a scared creature, and the cat came to help by tapping on the wall, leading the animals to find and return the creature to its home.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Will who loved playing at the beach. He often went to the beach with his mom. When they reached the beach one day, they saw a big, rolling tide. Will was getting dizzy just looking at it. His mom said, "We can play by the edge of the tide, but we can't go too far in, OK?" Will said, "Ok, mom." But before they knew it, they realized the tide was getting bigger and lapping closer to them. Will's mom said, "It looks like the tide is getting strong, so let's sit on the sand and watch it."Will was excited, but he knew he had to obey his mom. He said, "Ok, mom."They watched as the tide went higher and higher. Soon, the tide was so tall it looked like it was about to kiss the sky! Will's mom said to him, "I know you wanted to go play in the tide, but it looks like the tide won't allow us today. Let's go play somewhere else!" Will said, "Ok, mom!" and cheered. They packed up their things and ran off to someplace they could play safely.
Summary: A little boy named Will loved playing at the beach, but when they arrived, they saw a big, rolling tide that made him dizzy. Despite his desire to play in the tide, Will's mom told him they couldn't go too far in and they watched as the tide got bigger and lapped closer to them before they had to leave.
Story: One day, a mom and her daughter had an important job. They had to weigh the body of a giant giraffe. It was a difficult job, but the mom was strong and knew she could do it. They took the giraffe body to the scales and carefully put it on. The scales weighed the body and showed how big it was. The mom and daughter were very excited to see how big the giant giraffe was! Finally the job was done. They checked the scales and saw that the giraffe was super big. The mom and daughter smiled and gave each other a big hug. They did a great job and were very proud!
Summary: A mother and daughter worked together to weigh a giant giraffe's body, using a set of scales. After carefully placing the giraffe on the scales, they were amazed by its enormous size and proud of their successful job.
Story: Once upon a time, there were two twin sisters. They were adorable and loved to play together. One day, they found a toy and both wanted to play with it. They started to fight and argue about who should have it. Suddenly, the toy broke into two pieces. The sisters were sad and didn't know what to do. They tried to fix it, but it couldn't be fixed. They realized that the toy was not as important as their friendship. They hugged and said sorry to each other. But it was too late. The toy was broken and couldn't be fixed. They learned that sometimes things can't be undone and that they should always be kind to each other. From that day on, they shared everything and never fought again. Even though they didn't have the toy, they had each other and that was the most important thing.
Summary: Two twin sisters fought over a broken toy, but they realized that their friendship was more important than the toy. They learned that sometimes things can't be undone and that kindness towards each other is essential, so they shared everything and never fought again.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little lady called Claire. Claire was always trying to find the right balance between work and rest. She wanted to make sure she was happy and healthy.One day, she heard a really good idea. It said that she should take some rest each week. That way, she wouldn't get too tired.She tried it out, and found that it worked great. She felt much less dizzy and she had more fun in her day.From then on, Claire made sure to take some time to rest each week. That way, she could find the right balance for her busy life. She was very happy!
Summary: Claire, a busy lady, learned the importance of taking regular breaks to avoid burnout. By incorporating rest into her weekly routine, she found the right balance between work and rest, felt less dizzy, and had more fun in her day.
Story: Once upon a time there was an elderly chicken who lived on a farm. She always walked around looking for things to match. One day, she saw two small children in the barnyard. They were racing each other, so she decided to join them. The chicken said, "Hi, I'm here to match you." The children looked at each other and smiled. "What do you mean?" they asked. The chicken said, "Let's race to see who can get there first. I'll match you!" The children were so excited, they ran as fasts as they could. The chicken, being much older, was not as fast. But she still tried her hardest, and in the end, she was the one who won the race! The children cheered and clapped for the elderly chicken. They said, "You really matched us!" The chicken smiled, proud of her accomplishment. She said, "I guess I'm still the fastest old chicken around!"
Summary: An elderly chicken named Henrietta lived on a farm and enjoyed racing with small children. Despite being older and slower than the children, Henrietta won a race against them, earning their admiration and praise.
Story: Lily liked to play with her toy shark in the bath. She made it swim and splash and bite the bubbles. She pretended she was a brave diver who could talk to sharks.One day, her mom said, "Lily, we are going to the zoo. Do you want to see the real sharks?"Lily nodded and clapped her hands. She was very excited. She put on her hat and coat and got in the car.At the zoo, they saw many animals. Lily liked the monkeys and the lions and the penguins. But she wanted to see the sharks most of all.They came to a big tank with a glass wall. Lily saw the sharks swimming inside. They were big and gray and had sharp teeth. Lily was not scared. She was happy.She ran to the glass and kneeled down. She tapped on the glass and said, "Hello, sharks. I am Lily. I am your friend."The sharks did not answer. They just swam by. Lily felt sad. She wanted the sharks to talk to her.She looked at her mom and said, "Mom, why don't the sharks talk to me?"Her mom smiled and hugged her. She said, "Lily, sharks are very independent. They don't talk to anyone. They like to be alone. But they can hear you and see you. They know you are a kind and brave girl. And they like you too."Lily smiled and hugged her mom back. She said, "Thank you, mom. I love you. And I love the sharks too."She waved at the sharks and said, "Bye, sharks. See you soon."The sharks swam by and winked at her. Lily felt happy. She had a new friend.
Summary: Lily played with her toy shark in the bath and pretended to be a brave diver who could talk to sharks. At the zoo, she saw real sharks in a tank and tapped on the glass to say hello, but they didn't answer.
Story: Lisa and Ben are twins. They like to play in their room. They have many toys and books. They also have a big bed with a blue sheet.One day, Lisa and Ben are bored. They want to have some fun. They see the blue sheet on the bed. They have an idea."Let's make a tent with the sheet!" Lisa says."Good idea!" Ben says.They take the sheet and tie it to the chairs and the table. They make a big tent. They crawl inside. They pretend they are camping.They have fun for a while. They tell stories and jokes. They laugh and giggle.But then, they hear a loud noise. It is their mom. She is angry."What are you doing with the sheet?" she yells. "You made a big mess! You ruined the sheet! It has holes and stains!"She pulls the sheet away. She throws it in the trash. She scolds Lisa and Ben. She tells them to go to bed without dinner.Lisa and Ben are sad. They cry. They hug each other.They wish their mom was more compassionate. They wish she would care about their feelings. They wish they had a new sheet.
Summary: Lisa and Ben, twins who like to play in their room, create a tent with a blue sheet, but their mom is angry and ruins it, scolding them and taking away their fun. Lisa and Ben are sad and wish their mom was more compassionate and understanding of their desires for fun and creativity.
Story: Once upon a time there was a bright alligator. He was having a great day, exploring around the river. But then he fell into the water!The alligator was scared and he couldn't swim. He shouted out, "Help! Help!"Just then a little boy appeared. He was only three years old, but he knew exactly what to do. He picked up a big stick and called out, "Here alligator, grab onto this and I'll pull you back onto the bank!"The alligator was so grateful that he thanked the little boy. He said, "Thank you for giving me a helping hand! It looks like I owe you one!"The little boy smiled. He said, "That's ok alligator, you can be my friend!"The alligator was so happy that he said, "Well, let's go explore this river together!"And so they did! Every day they would explore together and share their adventures. The little boy and the bright alligator were the best of friends.
Summary: A bright alligator had a great day exploring around a river until he fell into the water and couldn't swim. A little boy appeared and helped the alligator by calling out to him and offering a stick to pull him back onto the bank, and the alligator was grateful and thanked him for his help.
Story: Little Joe was a brave boy. He was always very alert. He saw something strange one day. He needed to find out what it was. He came to a big knee and looked down. He saw an animal. Joe had never seen this animal before. He was curious and wanted to know more. He knew he needed to be alert. Joe slowly moved closer to the knee and took a closer look. He saw that the animal was a puppy. He was happy to know that the puppy needed a place to stay and Joe needed a new friend. Joe tucked the puppy under his arm and brought it home. He knew he had made a new best friend.
Summary: Little Joe was a curious boy who spotted an unusual animal while exploring, and he cautiously approached it to find a lost puppy that needed a new home. Excited to have found a new friend, Joe took the puppy home and became its new best friend.
Story: Ben and Sam are brothers. They like to play with cars. They have many cars, big and small, red and blue, fast and slow. But their favorite car is the old car. The old car is in the backyard. It does not work. It is dirty and rusty. It has a hole in the roof. It is rot."Let's play with the old car!" Ben says to Sam one day."Okay!" Sam says. They run to the backyard. They climb into the old car. They pretend to drive. They make noises with their mouths. Vroom, vroom, beep, beep!"Where are we going?" Sam asks Ben."We are going to the zoo!" Ben says. "We will see lions and monkeys and elephants!""Wow, that sounds fun!" Sam says. "But how will we get there? The old car is rot. It can not go."Ben thinks for a moment. He has an idea. He smiles."The old car is rot, but it is also original!" he says. "It is special. It has magic. If we close our eyes and wish hard, it will take us anywhere we want!""Really?" Sam says. He is not sure."Really!" Ben says. "Let's try it!"They close their eyes. They wish hard. They say, "Old car, old car, take us to the zoo!"They wait. They feel a bump. They hear a roar. They open their eyes. They see lions and monkeys and elephants!They are at the zoo!They are happy.They hug the old car.They say, "Thank you, old car, thank you!"
Summary: Ben and Sam are brothers who enjoy playing with cars, including an old car in their backyard that they pretend to drive and use for imaginative play. Despite the car's condition, Ben believes it has magic and can take them anywhere they want, and they successfully use it to visit the zoo.
Story: Max was a very honest little boy. He loved to watch the cartoons on TV. One day, he saw the nicest cartoon. It was bright and colourful and he really liked it. He asked his mom if he could cut it out.His mom got some scissors from the kitchen. Max sat down and looked carefully at the cartoon. With the scissors, he carefully cut around the cartoon. He was so proud and excited!When he finished, Max showed his mom his cut-out cartoon. She smiled and said it was very beautiful. She hung it up on the fridge so everyone could see it. Max was so happy, he smiled and gave his mom a big hug.
Summary: Max, a little boy, was fascinated by a colorful cartoon on TV and asked his mom if he could cut it out. With her help, he carefully cut around the cartoon and was proudly showed it to his mom, who hung it up on the fridge for everyone to see, making Max happy with a big hug.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a clever queen. She was very wise and wanted to help her people. She thought long and hard about how she could make their lives better.One day, the queen had a bright idea. She called for a meeting with her court. She said, "I will remove all of the taxes in our kingdom. This way, people will have more money to buy food and clothes." Everyone was very grateful to their queen. They thanked her for her kindness.A few days later, they noticed something strange. Everyone was so happy that they had more money that they stopped helping others. They started to keep the money all to themselves.The queen saw this and called for another meeting. She warned them that they should remember to always help each other. She said, "Remember to share your money with people who need it. You should never be selfish with your wealth."Once again, everyone was very grateful to their queen. They thanked her for her wise words.The moral of this story is to always be kind and generous to one another and to make sure to never be selfish. Being grateful is the best way to show our appreciation.
Summary: The clever queen wanted to help her people, so she removed all taxes in the kingdom, thinking it would improve their lives. However, people became selfish with their newfound wealth and stopped helping others, so the queen called for another meeting to remind them to be kind and generous, and to never be selfish with their wealth.

Tom said. "There is a sailor on the boat. He is waving at us. Do you think he is nice?""Maybe he is," Lily said. "Let's wave back and say hello."They waved their hands and shouted hello to the sailor. The sailor smiled and shouted hello too. He steered the boat closer to the shore and threw a rope to the dock. He jumped off the boat and walked towards Lily and Tom."Hello, little ones," he said. "I am Sam, the sailor. I have been sailing on the sea for a long time. I am happy to see you. What are your names?""I am Lily and this is Tom," Lily said. "We are playing on the beach. We like your boat and your red flag. Where did you come from?""I came from a faraway land," Sam said. "I have seen many things and met many people. I have some stories and some gifts for you. Do you want to hear and see them?""Yes, please!" Lily and Tom said. They were curious and excited."Then come with me to my boat," Sam said. "I will show you what I have. You are very welcome, Lily and Tom. You are my new friends."
Summary: Lily and Tom were playing on the beach when they saw a big boat with a red flag and a sailor waving at them. The sailor, Sam, came ashore and introduced himself to the children, showing them his stories and gifts from faraway lands.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toy rocket. He would run around the yard, making his rocket fly high in the sky. One day, while playing with his rocket, it got very dirty. Tim didn't like his rocket being dirty, so he decided to clean it.Tim went to his mom and said, "Mom, my rocket is dirty. Can you help me clean it?" His mom smiled and said, "Of course, Tim. Let's go inside and wash it." They went inside the house and washed the dirty rocket in the sink. Tim was very happy to see his rocket clean and shiny again.After cleaning the rocket, Tim went outside to play with his dog, Spot. Spot was chewing on a bone. Tim showed Spot his clean rocket and said, "Look, Spot! My rocket is clean now!" Spot wagged his tail and barked happily. Tim and Spot played with the rocket all day, having lots of fun together.
Summary: Tim, a little boy, loved playing with his toy rocket until it got dirty. He asked his mom for help cleaning it, and they washed it in the sink.
Story: The lake was bright and blue. John and Kadi were at the lake with their mum. Mum said to them, "Let's go for a dive!" Kadi said, "What's a dive?" Mum said, "It's like jumping into the lake, but you put your head in the water too."John said, "I want to do it!"Kadi was hesitant because she was scared of the water. Mum said, "It's OK. I'll show you what to do and make sure you're safe."Mum showed Kadi how to find the roots at the bottom of the lake. Then Kadi took a deep breath and dove. She held onto the root and felt happy and safe. John joined her, and the two kids had lots of fun diving and exploring. Mum smiled and watched. She was relieved that the kids were having fun and staying safe.
Summary: John and Kadi went to the lake with their mum, who suggested they go for a dive. Kadi was hesitant at first, but their mum showed her how to find the roots at the bottom of the lake and stay safe, and John joined in on the fun.
Story: Once upon a time there were two friends, Alex and Sam. They were going to play outside, but first they needed to park their bikes. Can we play here?"Sam said, "Yes! Let's play baseball!"Alex found a furry baseball in the grass. He held it out to Sam and said, "Look, I found a furry baseball. Let's throw it!"So they started playing catch. They would throw the furry baseball back and forth to each other. They had so much fun, they decided to play here every day. Story: Once upon a time, there was a thin man named Bob. He was very hungry and wanted dinner. Bob walked up to a big house and demanded dinner.The people inside the house said, "No, you can't have dinner."Bob was so mad. He said, "I demand dinner!"The people inside the house shook their heads and said, "No, you can't have dinner."Then Bob looked at them. He had an idea. He said, "Please, can I have dinner?"The people inside the house smiled. They said, "Yes, you can have dinner!"So Bob got his dinner. He was so happy. From then on, Bob never forgot to say "please" when he wanted something.
Summary: Bob, a hungry man, demanded dinner from a big house, but was refused. However, after politely asking for dinner, he was granted his request and learned the importance of saying "please."
Story: Lily was a little girl who loved to play with her toys. She had a big box of dolls, cars, animals and blocks. She liked to make up stories with them and pretend they were her friends. One day, she found a new toy in the box. It was a shiny red plane with wings and a propeller. Lily was very happy and excited. She wanted to make the plane fly.She took the plane to the living room, where her dad was reading a book. He was bald and wore glasses. Lily said, "Dad, look at my new plane! It can soar in the sky!"Dad smiled and said, "That's a nice plane, Lily. Where did you get it?"Lily said, "I found it in the toy box. Can I play with it here?"Dad said, "Sure, but be careful not to break anything. And don't fly too high or too fast."Lily nodded and said, "OK, dad. I will be careful." She held the plane in her hand and ran around the room, making zooming noises. She pretended the plane was soaring over mountains, oceans and clouds. She had a lot of fun.But then, she saw something shiny and white in the corner. It was the refrigerator. Lily thought, "Maybe the plane can soar on the refrigerator. It looks like a big hill." She ran towards the refrigerator and threw the plane in the air. She hoped it would land on the top.But the plane did not land on the top. It hit the door of the refrigerator and fell to the floor. It made a loud bang and a crack. The door of the refrigerator opened and some food fell out. Lily gasped and said, "Oh no! I broke the plane and the refrigerator!"Dad heard the noise and came to see what happened. He saw the mess and said, "Lily, what did you do?"Lily felt sorry and scared. She said, "I'm sorry, dad. I wanted the plane to soar on the refrigerator, but it didn't work. I didn't mean to break anything."Dad sighed and said, "Lily, you know you can't throw things at the refrigerator. It's not a hill, it's a machine. It keeps our food cold and fresh. And your plane is not a real plane, it's a toy. It can't fly by itself. You have to be gentle and careful with your toys and the things in the house."Lily nodded and said, "I understand, dad. I'm sorry. Can you fix the plane and the refrigerator?"Dad said, "I'll try, Lily. But you have to help me clean up the mess. And next time, if you want to make your plane soar, use your imagination. Or go outside and play in the park. There's plenty of space and air for your plane to soar there."Lily said, "OK, dad. I will do that. Thank you for being nice to me."Dad hugged Lily and said, "You're welcome, Lily. I love you. And I like your plane. It's very pretty."Lily smiled and said, "I love you too, dad. And I like your bald head. It's very shiny."
Summary: Lily, a little girl, found a new toy plane in her toy box and wanted to make it fly. However, she accidentally broke the plane and the refrigerator when she threw it at the latter, and her father had to clean up the mess and teach her to be gentle with her toys and the things in the house.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little mouse. The mouse liked to crawl around and explore the world. One day, the mouse saw some police officers walking by. They were wearing blue uniforms and had shiny badges on their chests. The mouse thought they looked very important.As the mouse continued to crawl, it saw a charming little house. The house had a red door and a white picket fence. The mouse decided to go inside and have a look around. Inside, it found a cozy room with a fireplace and a soft rug. The mouse thought it was the perfect place to take a nap.But just as the mouse was about to doze off, it heard a loud knock on the door. It was the police officers! They had been looking for the mouse, who they thought had been causing trouble. But when they saw the cute little mouse curled up by the fireplace, they couldn't help but smile. They decided to let the mouse stay in the charming little house and promised to come back and visit. And so, the little mouse lived happily ever after.
Summary: A curious mouse explored its surroundings and stumbled upon a cozy little house, where it decided to take a nap. However, the mouse was surprised by the arrival of police officers who had been searching for it, but instead of arresting it, they let the mouse stay in the house and promised to visit again.
Story: One day, Jack was walking through the forest. Suddenly, a terrible roar shook the ground! Jack was so scared he shut his eyes tight and started to cry.Just then, a gentle voice said, "it's ok Jack. I'm here." Jack opened his eyes, and there was a friendly wolf with a sparkly wink. Jack said, "Wolf, are you here to help me?"The wolf nodded and said, "Yes! I'm here to help. Let's set off and find a way out of the forest."Jack and the wolf set off together. As they walked, the wolf showed Jack all the wonderful things in the forest. Soon, they reached the edge of the forest, and Jack said goodbye to the wolf with a happy wink.

Jack and the wolf set off together, exploring the forest and discovering its wonders before reaching the edge of the forest, where Jack said goodbye to the wolf with a happy wink.
Story: Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big basket under a tree. The basket has many fruits and breads inside."Wow, look at this basket!" Lily says. "It has apples, bananas, oranges and more. Can we have some?"Tom shakes his head. "No, Lily, we can't. This basket is not ours. Maybe someone left it here for a picnic. We should not touch it."Lily pouts. "But I am hungry. And the fruits look so good. Just one bite, please?"Tom listens to Lily. He feels hungry too. But he remembers what his mom told him. "Never take things that are not yours. That is not nice. That is stealing."Tom says to Lily, "No, Lily, we can't. Come on, let's go play on the swings. Maybe we can find some snacks later."Lily sighs. She knows Tom is right. She follows him to the swings. They have fun swinging and laughing.Soon, they see a lady and a man walking to the tree. They have a blanket and a book. They smile when they see the basket."Look, honey, our basket is still here. What a great spot for a picnic!" the lady says.The man nods. "Yes, it is. And what a great day too. The sun is shining and the birds are singing. Let's enjoy our lunch."Lily and Tom watch them. They feel happy for them. They also feel proud of themselves. They did not take the basket. They did the right thing.They smile at each other and say, "We are great friends!"
Summary: Lily and Tom are friends who enjoy playing in the park, but when they come across a basket filled with fruits and bread, Tom reminds Lily that it's not theirs and they shouldn't take it, leading to a lesson about not stealing and being kind to others. The friends are happy to see a couple enjoying a picnic nearby and feel proud of themselves for doing the right thing.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a neighbor who was her friend. One day, Lily went to play with her neighbor. They played with a ball and ran around.Suddenly, the sun became very hot and they both felt very thirsty. Lily's neighbor said, "I am feeling hot. Can we go inside and drink some water?" Lily's neighbor's mom said, "Don't jump on the couch, it will break!" They stopped jumping and continued to play with their toys. They had a lot of fun together.

Story: Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play with their toys and books. But they do not like to eat the same things. Lily likes pasta and cheese. Ben likes rice and chicken. Every night, they have a problem when mom makes dinner."Time to eat, kids!" mom calls from the kitchen. "I made pasta and cheese for Lily and rice and chicken for Ben."Lily and Ben run to the table. They see their plates. Lily is happy. Ben is not."Mom, I do not want rice and chicken!" Ben says. "I want pasta and cheese like Lily!""Sorry, Ben, but you have to eat what I made for you. Pasta and cheese is for Lily. Rice and chicken is for you. It is important to eat different things. They are good for you." mom says."But I do not like rice and chicken!" Ben says. He pushes his plate away. He crosses his arms. He makes a sad face.Lily looks at Ben. She feels sorry for him. She likes pasta and cheese, but she also likes Ben. She decides to do something nice for him."Ben, do you want to trade with me?" Lily asks. "You can have my pasta and cheese, and I can have your rice and chicken. I do not mind. I like both."Ben looks at Lily. He is surprised. He smiles. He nods. He says, "Thank you, Lily. You are a good sister. I will trade with you."Lily and Ben trade their plates. They eat their dinner. They are happy. Mom is happy too. She says, "You are very kind, Lily. You made Ben happy. And you are very brave, Ben. You tried something new. I am proud of both of you."Lily and Ben hug mom. They say, "We love you, mom. And we love each other."
Summary: Lily and Ben are twins who have different food preferences, leading to a daily dinner time struggle. Lily offers to trade her pasta and cheese with Ben, making him happy and earning praise from their mother for being kind and brave.

It seemed to be full of adventure! Flopsy wanted to enter the tunnel, but it was shut. What could Flopsy do?Suddenly, Flopsy noticed a big button near the tunnel. Flopsy hopped up on its hind legs and pressed the button. The button made a loud sound and magically, the tunnel opened up! The door had released and Flopsy could now explore the high tunnel.Flopsy hopped inside the tunnel and began to explore. In the tunnel, Flopsy found so many wonderful things. What an exciting adventure!When Flopsy had finished exploring, Flopsy hopped outside and back into the sunshine. Flopsy had had so much fun!
Summary: Flopsy, a curious little bunny, found a high tunnel and wanted to explore it, but it was shut. Flopsy found a big button near the tunnel and pressed it, which made a loud sound and opened the tunnel, allowing Flopsy to have an exciting adventure inside.

Story: Once upon a time, there were two friends who were playing outside. Their names were Jack and Jennifer. They were having so much fun together.Suddenly, Jack started to joke with Jennifer. He thought it was funny, but Jennifer did not think it was funny. She started to cry and ran away.Jack felt so bad that he ran after her to say he was sorry. He gave her a rare firework to cheer her up. Jennifer was so happy and she smiled again.Jack was very relieved that his friend was happy again. They giggled together and made a promise never to joke again. They became best friends from that day on.
