When they arrived at the store, Daddy told Molly it was time to sign. Molly put her hand on the paper, and Daddy said â€œLook- that's your signature!â€ Molly was so proud of herself. Next, Daddy took Molly inside to get some gas. It was a fit truck, so Daddy let Molly push the button to make it fill up. They watched the machine whirring, then Daddy said â€œAll done!â€ and drove Molly home. Molly was so happy to have gone on the adventure with her daddy. She felt fit and excited, and she smiled all the way home.
Summary: Molly and her daddy went on an adventure together, driving to the store and filling up the car. At the store, Molly signed her name and was proud of herself, and then they went inside to get gas and watched the machine fill up the car.
Story: Lily and Tom were playing in the sand. They made a big castle with a tower and a flag. They had fun digging and pouring and patting the sand."Look, Mommy, look at our castle!" Lily shouted. She was proud of her work.Mommy came and smiled. "Wow, what a beautiful castle! You are very clever, Lily and Tom. But it is getting dark now. We have to go home and dress for dinner. Say goodbye to your castle."Lily and Tom did not want to go. They liked their castle. They wanted to play more."Please, Mommy, can we stay a little longer?" Tom asked. He looked at Mommy with big eyes.Mommy shook her head. "No, Tom, we have to go. It is too dark to play in the sand. You can come back tomorrow and make another castle. Come on, let's go and dress. I have a surprise for you at home."Lily and Tom wondered what the surprise was. They followed Mommy to the car. They waved to their castle and said goodbye. They hoped their castle would still be there tomorrow. They were curious about the surprise. They liked surprises.
Summary: Lily and Tom built a sandcastle with a tower and flag, and Lily was proud of their creation. However, their mother had to take them home for dinner, and they were reluctant to leave their castle behind, wondering what surprise their mother had in store for them.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a school full of delicate children. They loved to play outside, but one day a magical wind came and filled the school with lots of fairy dust. The children were so excited - they had never seen anything like it!They began to play and explore, dancing and laughing in the sparkly dust. They were filled with joy, spinning and jumping to see who could make the most beautiful shapes.The children spent all day playing and when the sun began to go down, the magical dust slowly disappeared, leaving the delicate children all the more filled with a sense of wonder. They knew they had experienced something special that day.
Summary: In a school filled with delicate children, a magical wind brought fairy dust that filled the school with sparkles and joy. The children danced and played, creating beautiful shapes and experiencing a special and wondrous day.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to run and play outside in the summer. It was so cool under the trees.One day, Timmy's ball rolled into his neighbor's yard. But his neighbor didn't like Timmy very much. He yelled at him and told him to go away.Timmy was sad and ran back home. But he didn't watch where he was going and tripped on a rock. He hurt his knee and had to go to the hospital.Timmy learned that it's important to be careful and not run too fast when you're upset. And he never went near his neighbor's yard again. The end.
Summary: Timmy, a boy who loves to run and play outside in the summer, had his ball roll into his neighbor's yard. However, his neighbor was unfriendly and yelled at Timmy, making him sad and causing him to trip and hurt his knee while running away.
Story: Once upon a time there was a little engine called Bob. Bob was very small but he was a hard worker. One day, Bob was organizing in the dark. All of a sudden a voice said, "What are you doing?". Bob looked around, but there was no one there. He wondered what kind of voice it was.Bob said, "I'm organizing." The voice said, "Let me help you!" Bob was a little bit scared, but he agreed.With the voice's help, Bob began to organize much faster than before. After an hour, Bob had finished organizing the room. He thanked the mysterious voice. The voice said, "You did an excellent job."Bob said goodbye to the voice and went off to find his friends. He thanked the voice for helping him organize in the dark.
Summary: Bob, a small but hardworking engine, was organizing in the dark when he heard a mysterious voice offering to help. With the voice's assistance, Bob finished organizing the room much faster than before and thanked the voice for its help.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and explore the world. One day, she met a friendly alien who came from a faraway planet. The alien was very fancy, with a shiny suit and a big smile.Lily was curious and asked the alien, "What planet are you from?" The alien replied, "I am from a planet called Zorg." Lily was amazed and asked, "What does Zorg taste like?" The alien laughed and said, "Zorg is not for tasting, but it is a beautiful planet with many colors and creatures."Lily and the alien became good friends and had many adventures together. They even went on a space trip to see other planets. When they returned, Lily's mom asked, "Where have you been?" Lily replied, "I went to space with my fancy alien friend. We saw many planets, but Zorg is the best because it is my friend's home."
Summary: Lily, a curious little girl, meets a friendly alien from a faraway planet called Zorg. The alien shows her around the galaxy and they become good friends, going on adventures together and exploring new worlds.
Story: Sara and Tom like to play in the forest. They look for animals and flowers and mushrooms. One day, they find a big mushroom with red dots. Sara wants to pick it, but Tom says no."That is a fairy mushroom," he says. "Fairies live under it. If you pick it, they will be angry."Sara does not believe him. She thinks he is making it up. She reaches for the mushroom, but Tom pulls her back."Look," he says. "There is a fairy. She is coming out of the mushroom."Sara and Tom see a tiny girl with wings and a dress. She has a crown of flowers on her head. She looks at Sara and Tom with a frown. She says something, but they cannot hear her."She is deaf," Tom says. "She cannot hear us. We have to bow to her. That is how we say sorry."Tom bows to the fairy. He hopes she will forgive them. Sara bows too, but she is still curious. She wants to touch the fairy. She reaches out her hand, but the fairy flies away."Bye, fairy," Tom says. "We are sorry. We will not touch your mushroom."Sara and Tom go back to their home. They tell their mom about the fairy. She smiles and hugs them."That is a wonderful story," she says. "But remember, do not pick mushrooms in the forest. Some of them are bad for you."Sara and Tom nod. They are happy. They have seen a fairy. They hope to see her again.
Summary: Sara and Tom explore the forest and find a big mushroom with red dots, but Tom warns Sara not to pick it because it's a fairy mushroom and fairies live under it. Despite Tom's warning, Sara reaches for the mushroom, but a tiny girl with wings and a dress appears and frowns at them, and they are forced to bow and apologize before the fairy flies away.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a beautiful bird called Zigzag. She was loved by all the animals in the forest. All the animals wanted to be her friend but she was too shy to make any.One day when Zigzag was flying, she saw a big eagle in the sky. He was so majestic, Zigzag felt jealous. She wanted to be as strong and majestic as him.The eagle noticed her jealousy and said with a friendly voice, "You are already amazing Zigzag, don't be jealous. Would you like to come fly with me?"Zigzag was so excited, she agreed and they set off flying together. The eagle taught Zigzag some cool tricks, like how to do a fast strike and how to zigzag around the sky. After the flight was over, the eagle said a big goodbye and left. But Zigzag was so happy, she was now flying like a majestic eagle and she wasn't jealous anymore.
Summary: Zigzag, a shy bird, was envious of an eagle's majesty and wanted to fly like him. The eagle noticed her jealousy and offered to teach her how to fly, showing her cool tricks and making her feel proud of her own abilities.
Story: One day, a little boy called Tom went for a walk with his mom. They were looking for something special. Tom asked his mom what it was, but she just said "You'll see!"Eventually, they came to a green field surrounded by trees. Tom asked his mom, "What is this special thing?" She smiled and replied "It's the Earth!"Tom was so excited. He looked around and saw some birds flying, a bee buzzing and grass swaying in the breeze. "Wow!" he said.Suddenly, Tom saw a balloon in the distance. He ran over to it, but it was just out of his reach. His mom said it was ok, but to be careful he didn't lose it. Tom jumped and jumped, but he couldn't catch the balloon. He started to cry - but then he heard a voice say, "Don't worry," and the balloon floated back down to him.Tom was so happy he hugged the balloon tight and never wanted to lose it again. He ran back to his mom with the balloon, and they both smiled. Happiness is never lost when you look after the Earth!
Summary: Tom went on a walk with his mom and was excited to find something special. They eventually arrived at a green field surrounded by trees, and Tom's mom revealed that the special thing was the Earth itself, which made Tom happy and grateful for the beauty of nature.
Story: John and his friend Mathilda were walking in the forest. Suddenly, they saw a raven flying in the sky. John said to Mathilda, "Look, there's a raven!"Mathilda said, "That's amazing! I love ravens!"John replied, "Me too. I love how they glide through the sky."Suddenly, the raven made a loud screech and flew away.John said sadly, "Why did it leave us? We were just admiring it."The sun had already set and the woods were becoming darker. John felt miserable.Mathilda said, "Don't worry. Its love will always be with us."John felt better and hugged Mathilda. Together, they walked back home.
Summary: John and Mathilda were walking in the forest when they saw a raven flying overhead, which they both found fascinating. Despite the raven's sudden departure, John felt comforted by Mathilda's words of encouragement and they continued on their way home together.
Story: Once upon a time, there was an elderly woman who liked to record her memories. She liked to write down her stories and experiences so she would always remember them. One day, she decided to make something special to record these memories.She went and got some clay from outside and brought it home. She started to shape the clay into a round plate using her fingers. Once it was finished, she was really happy with the result. She used it to record her memories and her stories, and whenever she looked at it she remembered all the good things that happened to her over the years.The elderly woman and the clay plate became a reminder for her of all the things she wanted to be and all the experiences she wanted to remember.
Summary: An elderly woman recorded her memories and stories on a clay plate, which served as a reminder of her experiences and aspirations. Through her craft, she was able to hold onto her memories and reflect on the good things that had happened to her over the years.
Story: Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to slide, swing and run. They saw a big balloon in the sky. It was red and yellow and blue. It looked like a rainbow."Wow, look at that balloon!" Lily said. "It is so pretty and big!""I want to go inside it," Ben said. "It must be fun to fly in the air.""That is not a balloon, silly," Lily said. "That is a gas bag. It has gas inside that makes it go up. You cannot go inside it. It is not safe."Ben did not believe Lily. He thought she was scared. He wanted to show her he was brave. He said, "I dare you to touch the gas bag. If you touch it, I will give you my candy."Lily did not want to touch the gas bag. She knew it was not a good idea. But she also liked candy. And she did not want Ben to think she was a chicken. She said, "Okay, I dare you to touch it first. If you touch it, I will give you my doll."Ben agreed. He ran towards the gas bag. He did not see the rope that was holding it to the ground. He tripped over the rope and fell. He hurt his knee and started to cry.Lily ran to help him. She felt sorry for him. She said, "Are you okay, Ben? I am sorry I dared you. It was a bad dare. You do not have to touch the gas bag. It is not original. It is just a gas bag. Here, have some candy."Ben smiled. He said, "Thank you, Lily. You are a good friend. I am sorry I dared you too. It was a silly dare. You do not have to touch the gas bag either. It is not pretty. It is just a gas bag. Here, have my doll."They hugged and shared their toys. They decided to play something else. They did not care about the gas bag anymore. They had more fun with each other.
Summary: Lily and Ben were playing in the park when they saw a big balloon in the sky. Ben dared Lily to touch the gas bag, but she declined and instead offered him her doll.
Story: Once there was a little child who wanted to go for a nice march. With a smile on her face, she put on her warm coat and started walking towards the park.When the child reached the park, she smiled as she saw all the trees and flowers. She began to march along the path, looking at all the pretty things and taking deep breaths of the sweet scented air.The child saw lots of birds and butterflies in the park, so she stopped marching and decided to chase them. She grass was so warm and soft and the sun was so bright and beautiful.The little child had a wonderful time. She felt so happy and content as she marched back home, thinking about all the things she had seen and done.
Summary: A little girl put on her warm coat and walked to the park, enjoying the sights and sounds of nature. She chased birds and butterflies, feeling happy and content as she marched back home, reflecting on her fun day in the park.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a girl called Lucy. She lived with her mommy and daddy and loved playing outside. One day, she was playing with her toys in the garden when she saw a small box in the middle of the grass.Lucy excitedly picked it up and opened it. Inside the box was a pile of money!"Mommy! Look what I found!"Mommy came over and said, "That's lovely, darling! What are you going to do with it?"Lucy smiled and said, "I'm going to put it in my pocket and take it to buy ice cream!"Lucy put the money in her pocket and ran off to get her ice cream. But when she got to the ice cream shop, the money had vanished!"Oh no!" she said. "My money has gone!"Mommy gave Lucy a cuddle and said, "Don't worry, darling. We'll keep looking and find it again soon." Lucy was sad but mommy bought her an ice cream as a treat. She learned a very important lesson that day - never leave money lying around, as it might just vanish!
Summary: Lucy found a box of money in the garden and was excited to buy ice cream with it, but it disappeared when she got to the shop. Despite losing the money, Lucy's mommy comforted her and bought her an ice cream as a treat, teaching her an important lesson about being careful with money.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a wise otter. The otter lived in a river and loved to swim and play with his friends. One day, the otter found a pencil and paper. He wanted to write a story about his adventures in the river. The otter wrote about how he swam with his friends and caught fish for dinner. He also wrote about the big rocks in the river that they liked to climb on. When he was finished writing, he showed his story to his friends. They were so happy and proud of him. From that day on, the otter wrote many more stories. He wrote about all the fun things he did with his friends in the river. And everyone loved to read his stories. The end.
Summary: A wise otter lived in a river and enjoyed swimming and playing with his friends. He discovered a pencil and paper and wrote stories about his adventures in the river, which his friends loved to read.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play outside. One day, she went for a walk in the forest and found a purple flower. She picked it up and smelled it. It smelled so nice!Suddenly, she heard a voice behind her. "Hello, little girl!" It was a woodcutter with an axe. He asked her, "What are you doing here?"Lily answered, "I found a pretty flower. Look!" She showed him the purple flower. The woodcutter said, "That's nice. But be careful, it's getting cold outside. You might freeze." Lily thanked him and went back home with her flower. She was happy and warm.
Summary: Lily, a little girl who loves to play outside, finds a purple flower in the forest and picks it, enjoying its nice smell. A woodcutter appears and warns her about the cold weather, causing Lily to thank him and return home with her flower.
Story: Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a bald man named Tom. Tom had a big, round head with no hair on it. He loved to go for walks around the town every day at noon.One sunny day, as Tom was walking, he saw a little cat. The cat was very pretty and had soft, shiny fur. Tom said to the cat, "Hello, little cat. Do you want to walk with me?" The cat looked at Tom and said, "Meow!" So Tom and the cat started to walk together.As they walked, the cat began to follow Tom. They went up and down the streets, and the cat stayed right behind Tom. They walked until the sun was high in the sky, and it was noon. Tom looked at the cat and said, "Thank you for walking with me, little cat. It is time for me to go home now." The cat looked at Tom and said, "Meow!" Then the cat followed Tom all the way back to his house, where they both took a nap in the warm sun.
Summary: Tom, a bald man, goes for a walk every day at noon and encounters a pretty cat who follows him on his strolls around the town. Tom and the cat walk together until the sun is high in the sky, and then the cat follows Tom home and they take a nap together in the warm sun.
Story: Lily wanted to play with the plastic cups and plates in the kitchen. She liked to pretend she was having a tea party with her dolls and stuffed animals. She asked her mom if she could use them."Mom, can I play with the plastic things?" Lily said."Sure, honey, you can play with the plastic things. But be careful not to break them or make a mess, okay?" Mom said."Okay, Mom, I will be careful. Thank you!" Lily said. She took the plastic things to her room and set up a table with a cloth and some flowers. She invited her dolls and stuffed animals to join her."Hello, everyone, welcome to my tea party. I have some yummy snacks for you. Do you like spicy food?" Lily said.She gave each of her guests a plastic plate with a cracker and a slice of cheese. She poured some water into the plastic cups and added some red sauce from a bottle."This is ketchup. It is spicy and tasty. Do you want some?" Lily said.She put some ketchup on her cracker and cheese and took a bite. She made a face and spit it out."Yuck! This is too spicy for me. I don't like it. Do you like it?" Lily said.She looked at her dolls and stuffed animals. They did not say anything. They did not eat their food. They looked unhappy."Maybe you don't like spicy food either. I'm sorry. I will get you something else. Do you want some cookies or fruit?" Lily said.She ran to the kitchen to find something else for her guests. She hoped they would not be mad at her. She wanted them to have fun at her tea party. She loved them very much.
Summary: Lily wanted to have a tea party with her dolls and stuffed animals using plastic cups and plates in the kitchen, but they didn't like the spicy food she served. Lily tried to find something else for them to eat, but they still looked unhappy.

Alexa couldn't believe it was happening. She had never seen a flood before.Suddenly, she felt very sad. The water was going to ruin all of her favorite things. She started to tear up and could no longer hold her tears back. She sat down in the middle of the street and started to cry.But then something amazing happened. Alexa heard a loud noise, and when she looked up, she realized that it was a big truck. But this truck wasn't like the others. It was an expensive truck that was carrying sandbags.The people in the truck started to throw the sandbags down into the water, and Alexa watched as the water started to go away. She was so relieved and happy.At that moment, Alexa knew that she was safe and nothing bad would ever happen to her again. She smiled and thanked the people in the truck for helping her.
Summary: Alexa was scared and sad as a flood started to occur outside, but then a truck arrived carrying sandbags that helped to stop the water from rising and make her feel safe again. Alexa was relieved and grateful to the people in the truck for their help, and she smiled and thanked them.
Story: Once upon a time there was a pretty trumpet. Every day the trumpet would play a song to the birds in the sky. The birds were so happy when they heard the trumpet that they would sway and dance in the air.One night, the trumpet was very tired and decided it needed to sleep. So it closed its eyes, took a deep breath, and went off to sleep.In the morning, the trumpet woke up. It felt so refreshed! It played its song over and over and the birds sang along. It was the prettiest trumpet anyone had ever heard! The trumpet kept playing its song every day and night until it was time for it to go to sleep again. And every time it did so, the birds would sing and dance. It was a great life for the trumpet, and it was very happy.
Summary: A pretty trumpet played a song for birds in the sky every day, making them happy and dancing in the air. The trumpet eventually got tired and went to sleep, but when it woke up, it felt refreshed and continued to play its song for the birds, who sang along and danced with joy.

So it decided to shrink and make itself smaller.The cow shrunk and shrunk, until it was small enough to fit through its skin. Now it was so small that it was hard to see.But then there was a problem â€“ the cow was too small. It was so small that it could not eat the juicy grass. So it began to grow back.The cow grew and grew, until it was big enough to eat the juicy grass. Now it was so big and so tight, that it could barely fit into its skin. But that was okay, because it was happy to be able to eat again.
Summary: A cow once shrunk to fit through its own skin, but it became too small to eat the juicy grass. So, it grew back to its original size, but now it was too big to fit into its skin.

Story: Once upon a time, there was a little mouse. The mouse was very obedient. He always did what his mom and dad told him to do. They lived in a tiny house near a big tree. The tree had many flowers that would bloom.One day, the mouse saw a big red flower. The flower was very pretty when it bloomed. The mouse wanted to play with the flower. But his mom and dad said, "No, don't go near the flower. It is not safe."The obedient mouse listened to his mom and dad. But one day, he saw other mice playing near the flower. They looked so happy. The little mouse thought, "Maybe it is safe to play there." So, he went to play with the other mice and the big red flower.But then, a big wind came. The wind blew the flower and it fell on the little mouse. The other mice ran away, but the little mouse could not move. His mom and dad found him and they were very sad. They wished the little mouse had stayed obedient and listened to them.The moral of the story is to always listen to your mom and dad. They know what is best for you and want to keep you safe.
Summary: A little mouse was obedient to his parents and avoided a dangerous flower, but when he saw other mice playing near it, he disobeyed and was blown away by a wind. The moral of the story is that children should always listen to their parents and follow their advice to stay safe.
Story: Once upon a time there were two friends, Pete and Sue. They both loved playing outside and had lots of special equipment each day.One day Pete and Sue had a play date. Pete got out his biggest bike while Sue got out an even bigger scooter. Pete was upset because he wanted to ride the scooter instead."Why can't I ride the scooter?" asked Pete."Because I already said that I was going to ride it," replied Sue.Pete was very upset and began to cry. Sue felt so sorry for him that she offered to switch and let him ride the scooter. Pete happily accepted the offer and they both went off to have fun.The moral of the story is that no matter how upset you are, it's important to accept the kindness of others. When you accept helpful offers, it brings people closer together and can make both of you really happy.
Summary: Pete and Sue are friends who love playing outside, but one day Pete wants to ride Sue's scooter instead of his bike. Sue is kind and offers to let Pete ride the scooter, making both of them happy.
Story: One day, a mighty lion was taking a nap in the jungle. He was resting so peacefully, that nothing would wake him up.Suddenly, a little bird flew in and put a bright flower on the lion's head. The petals tickled the lion and he woke up with a big yawn!The lion was very surprised to see the wee bird still there. He asked,"Why did you put that flower on my head!?"The tiny bird replied,"I wanted to show you how mighty and strong you are. So, I thought the flower would make you look even more magnificent!"The lion smiled and said, "Thank you for the kind gesture, my little friend. It was just what I needed to wake me up!" The lion and the bird shared a big hug and remained friends forever.
Summary: A lion was taking a nap in the jungle when a little bird unexpectedly placed a flower on his head, startling him awake. The lion was grateful for the bird's kind gesture and the two became friends, sharing a hug and appreciating each other's unique qualities.
Story: Once upon a time there was a young girl named Tina. She was very humble and always willing to help others. One day she was walking in the park when she heard a loud noise coming from behind a tree. She went to investigate and found a large bird that was flapping about in a panic. It had a broken wing and couldn't fly away.Tina spoke softly to calm the bird and explained to it why it needed to stay quiet. But the bird was scared and kept flapping about trying to get away.Tina thought of a plan. She ran back to her house and returned with a box filled with small grains of food. She offered the bird some food, but the bird was still scared. She then took out a piece of string and explained to the bird that if it stayed still she would tie the string around it's broken wing and it wouldn't be able to fly away. The bird looked at Tina, wondering if she could really save it. She smiled and nodded reassuringly, and the bird began to trust her. After a few minutes the bird was still enough for Tina to tie the string around its wing. The bird was now safe and wouldn't be able to fly. Tina had saved the bird and it was time for her to go. She smiled and waved goodbye before walking away, feeling proud of her humble and selfless deed.
Summary: Tina, a kind and humble girl, found a bird with a broken wing in a park and saved it by tying a string around its wing to keep it from flying away. Despite the bird's initial fear and resistance, Tina's gentle and reassuring manner helped it to trust her, and she was able to successfully help the bird.

Daisy even laid back and soaked up some sunshine!After a while, Daisy was ready to get back out of the river. She and her mommy wrapped themselves in towels, tight and snug, and headed back home. Story: Sara and Ben are playing with their toy boat in the bathtub. They pretend to be sailors and explore the water. Sara likes to make waves with her hand and splash Ben. Ben likes to open the boat and put his toy animals inside."Look, I have a lion and a zebra in my boat," Ben says. "They are going to a new land.""That's silly," Sara says. "Lions and zebras don't like water. They are afraid of sharks.""No, they are not," Ben says. "They are brave and strong. They can fight the sharks."Sara wants to see the animals in Ben's boat. She reaches for the boat and tries to open it. Ben holds the boat tight and pulls it away."Stop it, Sara," Ben says. "This is my boat. You can't open it.""Yes, I can," Sara says. "I want to see the animals. Let me open it."They tug and pull on the boat. The boat slips from their hands and falls on the floor. The boat breaks and the animals fall out. The water spills everywhere."Oh no," Ben says. "You broke my boat. You are a bad sailor.""I'm sorry, Ben," Sara says. "I didn't mean to break it. I just wanted to see the animals."They look at the broken boat and the wet floor. They feel sad and angry. They start to cry.Mom hears them crying and comes to the bathroom. She sees the mess and the broken boat."What happened here?" Mom asks."Sara broke my boat," Ben says."Ben wouldn't let me open it," Sara says.Mom sighs and picks up the boat and the animals. She dries them with a towel."I'm sorry your boat is broken, Ben," Mom says. "But you shouldn't be so selfish. You should share your toys with Sara. She is your sister and she wants to play with you.""I'm sorry I tried to open your boat, Ben," Sara says. "But you shouldn't be so mean. You should let me see your animals. They are cute and I like them."Mom hugs them and gives them a kiss."It's okay, Sara and Ben," Mom says. "You both made a mistake. But you can still be friends and sailors. Why don't you help me clean up this mess and then we can make some hot chocolate? It's very icy outside and you need to warm up."Sara and Ben nod and smile. They help Mom clean up the water and the floor. They say sorry to each other and hug. They go to the kitchen and drink hot chocolate. They forget about the broken boat and the animals. They talk about their adventures as sailors and the new lands they want to explore. They are happy again.
Summary: Sara and Ben are playing in the bathtub, pretending to be sailors and exploring the water. They have a disagreement over Ben's toy boat and it breaks, causing them to cry and get in trouble with their mom.

But her mom didn't answer. She was alone and she started to weep. But then suddenly a voice said, "Don't be scared sweetheart. I'm here." She looked around and saw that it was her mom. She was standing in the room with her own flashlight in her hand. The little girl stopped weeping and she went over to her mom. She hugged her tight and felt so safe. Her mom said, "I knew you would be scared in the dark, so I brought you my flashlight." The little girl was so thankful and she said, "Thank you mommy. I love you!" The ball popped and flew in the air. Ben and Lily were in shock. They stopped and stared at the ball. They felt sad and scared.The car stopped and the driver got out. He was a nice man. He saw Ben and Lily and said, "I'm sorry, kids. I didn't see your ball. Are you okay?" He walked to them and gave them a new ball. He said, "This is for you. Be careful and don't play in the street. It's dangerous."Ben and Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, sir. We're sorry, too. We'll be careful." They took the new ball and hugged the man. He hugged them back and said, "You're welcome. Have fun and stay safe."Ben and Lily went back to the park and played with their new ball. They were happy and grateful. They learned to watch out for cars and to stay away from the street. Timmy and his grandpa played catch with a ball outside. Timmy threw the ball very far and it landed in the bushes. They had to look for it for a while, but they finally found it. Later that night, Timmy heard a loud noise coming from the woods. He was scared, but his grandpa told him it was just an owl. Timmy felt much better and went to sleep. The end.
Summary: Timmy visited his grandpa's cabin in the woods and played catch with him outside. Later that night, Timmy heard a loud noise in the woods, but his grandpa reassured him it was just an owl and he went to sleep.
Story: Once there was a poor little boy called Tom.Tom was walking in the park one day, when he saw a pie lying on the ground.Tom knew he was poor, so he was very excited to find this pie.He walked up to it and kicked it.The pie was so ripe that it broke open, and delicious filling spilled out all over the ground.Tom was so happy! He stayed in the park for hours, eating up all the pie.When he was done, he felt a lot better than when he started.He had learned something from the Pie - that no matter how poor you are, you should never forget to have fun!
Summary: Tom, a poor little boy, found a pie on the ground in the park and was excited to eat it, despite his poverty. He kicked the pie and it broke open, spilling delicious filling all over the ground, making him happy and teaching him to never forget to have fun, no matter how poor he is.
Story: Once there was a little boy named Steve. He loved to clap his hands and make funny sounds that would make him laugh. One day, he was playing in the kitchen while his mom was washing dishes. Suddenly, the faucet started to make a funny noise and Steve started to clap. His mom was embarrassed but started to laugh. Steve kept clapping for the funny noise until his mom told him to stop. He was sad but went off to play outside. The next day, he came back and this time, he put his hands over his ears instead of clapping when the faucet made noise. His mom was so proud of him and gave him a big hug.
Summary: Steve, a little boy, found joy in clapping and making funny sounds, especially when the faucet in the kitchen made a strange noise. Despite his mom's initial embarrassment, she was proud of Steve for covering his ears instead of clapping when the faucet made noise the next day.
Story: Ben and Lily were playing in the park. They liked to swing, slide and run. They were happy and laughed a lot. But Lily had a loose tooth. She felt it wiggle with her tongue. She wanted it to fall out, so she could put it under her pillow and get a coin from the tooth fairy."Look, Ben, my tooth is loose!" she said, showing him her mouth."Wow, can I touch it?" he asked, reaching for her tooth."No, it's mine!" she said, pulling away. "Maybe it will fall out soon."They kept playing, but Lily was thinking about her tooth. She hoped it would fall out today. She swung higher and higher on the swing. She felt the wind in her hair and the sun on her face. She was having fun.But then, something bad happened. Ben pushed her too hard on the swing. She lost her grip and flew off the seat. She landed on the ground with a thud. She felt pain in her mouth and saw blood on her hand. She started to cry."Ow, ow, ow!" she wailed. "Ben, you hurt me!""I'm sorry, Lily, I didn't mean to!" he said, running to her. "Are you okay?"He helped her get up and looked at her mouth. He saw something white and shiny on the grass. It was her tooth. It had fallen out when she hit the ground."Look, Lily, your tooth!" he said, picking it up. "It fell out!"Lily stopped crying and looked at her tooth. She felt sad and happy at the same time. She had lost her tooth, but she had also found it. She took it from Ben and held it in her hand."Thank you, Ben," she said, smiling. "You helped me lose my tooth. Now I can get a coin from the tooth fairy."She hugged him and he hugged her back. They were friends again. They went to the water fountain and rinsed their mouths. Then they went to find their mom and dad. They wanted to tell them about their adventure. They had a thick story to share.
Summary: Lily and Ben were playing in the park when Lily's tooth suddenly fell out. Ben helped her find it and she was happy to have lost her tooth, but sad at the same time, as she wanted to put it under her pillow to get a coin from the tooth fairy.
Story: Once there was a little girl named Lucy. She was only three years old and very excited to go on her first vacation with her family. But when they got to the airport, Lucy realized she had forgotten her passport! Everyone was very sad and frustrated. Lucy felt very restless and did not know what to do. Her mum said, "Lucy, I'm so sorry! We will have to go home now."Lucy was so unhappy. She looked at her mum and said sadly, "I miss my passport". Mum felt really bad. She remembered that Lucy's passport was in her little suitcase at home. She took Lucy's hand in hers and said, "Come on, let's go home and get it!"Lucy smiled and said, "Yay!" The whole family were so happy to finally go on their holiday. They all had a wonderful time.
Summary: Lucy, a 3-year-old girl, forgot her passport on her first vacation and became upset, but her mother found it in their suitcase and they were able to go on their holiday after all, having a wonderful time together. Lucy was happy to have her passport back and the family enjoyed their trip.
Story: Once upon a time there was an old farmer who wanted to teach his three year old grand daughter the meaning of an inch. The farmer was very patient and mild. He measured a ruler with his fingers, which were an inch wide. Then he explained to her that an inch is the width of his finger. He showed her how to measure things using the inch. The farmer taught his grand daughter how to measure other things too. He taught her how to measure one apple and then three apples, using the inch as a guide. Then he showed her how to measure other items in the yard, such as his big hat or the fence. At the end of the day, the old farmer taught his grand daughter how to measure things, using the exact same method every time: one inch equals the width of his finger. Even though she was only three years old, she had learned how to measure things accurately. The old farmer smiled and said, "Now you know how to measure things using the inch."
Summary: An old farmer taught his three-year-old granddaughter the meaning of an inch by measuring his fingers and showing her how to measure other objects using the same method. Throughout the day, the farmer patiently taught his granddaughter how to measure various items in the yard, using the consistent measurement of one inch equaling the width of his finger.
Story: Sara loved her new shoes. They were pink and shiny and had a bow on each side. She wanted to wear them every day, even when it rained or snowed. Mama said no, those shoes were for sunny days only. Sara did not like that. She wanted to show her shoes to everyone.One day, Sara had a plan. She hid her new shoes in her backpack and wore her old boots to school. She thought Mama would not notice. She was wrong. Mama saw the shoes peeking out of the backpack and said, "Sara, what are you doing with your new shoes? You know they are not for rainy days."Sara said, "But Mama, I want to wear them. They are so beautiful. Please, please, let me wear them."Mama shook her head. "No, Sara, you can't. The rain will ruin your shoes. They will get wet and dirty and lose their shine. You don't want that, do you?"Sara pouted. She did not want that, but she also did not want to wear her old boots. She said, "But Mama, no one will see my shoes if I wear my boots. How can I show them to my friends?"Mama smiled. She had an idea. She said, "How about this? You can wear your new shoes inside the school, but you have to wear your boots outside. That way, you can prevent the rain from hurting your shoes, and you can still show them to your friends. What do you think?"Sara thought for a moment. She liked Mama's idea. She said, "Okay, Mama, I think that's a good idea. Thank you, Mama. You are so smart."Mama hugged Sara. She said, "You're welcome, Sara. You are so sweet. Now, let's go to school. And don't forget to change your shoes when you go outside, okay?"Sara nodded. She was happy. She could wear her new shoes and keep them beautiful. She hoped her friends would like them too. She kissed Mama and said, "Okay, Mama, I won't forget. I love you, Mama."Mama said, "I love you too, Sara. Have a good day at school."
Summary: Sara wanted to wear her new pink and shiny shoes every day, but her mother said no, they were only for sunny days. Sara found a way to wear her shoes inside the school but change into her boots when it rained or snowed, so she could still show them off to her friends.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Sarah. Every day she liked to go for a walk in the park with her mom. One day, Sarah saw a chair in the park. She was so glad that she could sit on it. She quickly ran up to the chair and said, "Mom, look! I found a chair".Sarah's mom smiled and said, "Yes, I see it! You can sit on it". Sarah climbed onto the chair and looked around the park. Suddenly, the chair started shaking. Sarah tried to get off the chair, but she was stuck! She screamed for help, but no one came.After a while, Sarah had to give up. She was extremely sad. Then she heard her mom's voice, "Oh Sarah, I'm so glad I found you".Sarah's mom was very angry. She took Sarah home and warned her never to climb onto chairs in the park again. Sarah was upset and wished she had never looked at the chair.
Summary: Sarah, a little girl, found a chair in the park and climbed onto it, but it started shaking and she got stuck. Her mother found her and was angry, warning Sarah never to climb onto chairs in the park again, making Sarah upset and wishing she had never looked at the chair.
Story: Ben and Lily were playing in the park. They liked to swing, slide and run. But Ben's favorite thing was to climb the big tree. He was very good at it. He could go up and down very fast."Look at me, Lily!" he shouted. "I am on the top branch!"Lily looked up and saw Ben. He was very high. She felt scared. She did not like to climb the tree. She liked to stay on the ground."Ben, come down!" she urged. "It is not safe up there!"Ben laughed. He did not want to come down. He liked to feel the wind and see the sky. He liked to hold the rough bark and the green leaves in his palm. He felt free and happy."No, Lily, you come up!" he said. "It is fun up here!"Lily shook her head. She did not want to go up. She felt dizzy and weak. She did not like to leave the light and the grass. She felt safe and cozy."No, Ben, I don't want to!" she said. "I am scared of the tree!"Ben saw Lily's face. She looked sad and worried. He felt sorry for her. He did not want to make her unhappy. He decided to come down."Okay, Lily, I will come down," he said. "But you have to try something new too. How about we go on the seesaw?"Lily smiled. She liked the seesaw. She thought it was fun and easy. She nodded."Okay, Ben, I will go on the seesaw," she said. "But you have to be careful on the tree!"Ben and Lily ran to the seesaw. They took turns to go up and down. They laughed and talked. They had fun. They were good friends.
Summary: Ben and Lily were playing in the park, with Ben enjoying climbing the big tree while Lily preferred to stay on the ground. Despite Lily's fear, Ben convinced her to try the seesaw, which they both enjoyed, showing their friendship and willingness to try new things together.
Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She liked to climb trees in her yard. One day, she saw a rough tree with big branches. Mia thought it would be fun to climb.Mia went to her mom and said, "Mom, can I climb the rough tree?" Her mom said, "Be careful, Mia. The tree is very rough and the branches are high. Maybe wait for dad to come home."But Mia did not want to wait. She went outside and started to climb the rough tree. When she was up high, she saw a big bird's nest. It was so pretty! But then, she heard a loud "caw!" The big bird was not happy. Mia got scared and started to cry.Just then, her dad came home from work. He heard Mia crying and ran to help her. He climbed the rough tree and helped Mia get down. Mia was so happy to be safe. She promised to never climb the rough tree again without her dad.From that day on, Mia always waited for her dad to climb trees with her. They had lots of fun and Mia learned to be more careful. The big bird was happy too, because no one disturbed its nest anymore.
Summary: Mia, a curious little girl, climbed a rough tree without her mom's permission, but when she got scared and started crying, her dad came to the rescue and helped her get down safely. From then on, Mia always waited for her dad to climb trees with her, and they had fun together while being careful not to disturb any birds' nests.
Story: Once upon a time there was a tidiest onion in the world. It lived with a farmer who loved it very much. Every day the farmer would take care of the onion and clean it until it was sparkly and new. One day, the onion broke. The farmer was so sad, she did not know what to do. Then she remembered that she had a special toolbox. In it, there were lots of tools to repair things. The farmer quickly grabbed the toolbox and opened it. She took out the hammer, the saw and finally the glue. She used the hammer to hammer the onion back together, the saw to cut off the broken parts and the glue to put it all back together. Once the onion was repaired, it looked as good as new. The farmer was so happy and relieved. She gave the onion a big hug and kissed it. The onion was safe and happy once again!
Summary: The tidiest onion in the world lived with a farmer who cared for it daily, but one day it broke. The farmer used a toolbox with various tools to repair the onion, including a hammer, saw, and glue, and successfully put it back together, making the onion look as good as new.

They explained that it was impossible, but the boy kept wishing.He thought and thought about how he could fly in the sky until one day he had an amazing idea. He could build a special plane and use it to fly way up above the clouds. His mom and dad thought it was a great idea and helped him build it.Finally, the day came when the plane was finished, and his mom and dad sent him off in the plane. Up he flew, high in the sky, and his mom and dad watched proudly as he flew away. The boy waved goodbye and flew higher and higher, exploring the amazing view of the sky above.

The pin was so scared that it stopped glowing altogether.It was all alone in the dark and it was so ashamed of itself. It wished it could just go back home and glow as brightly as before.But the pin never got back home. Instead, it just stayed in the dark forever, never to glow again.

The rain will make the paint run. But I promise I will give my best to come back tomorrow and finish it."Sam smiled. He was happy that the painter was reliable and that he would complete the work soon.The next day, the sun was shining and the painter did an amazing job. Sam looked at his house and said, "It looks beautiful!"The painter said, "See, no need to delay!"

Lucy brought her favorite book, a small dictionary, to help them learn new words.At the park, Lucy opened the dictionary and said, "Max, let's learn the word 'ball'." Max looked at the book and said, "I know that word! I love to play with my ball." Lucy smiled and said, "Great! Let's learn the word 'jump' now." Max jumped up and down, showing that he knew that word too.As Lucy and Max were learning, a big rain cloud came. It started to rain very hard. The rain made the park all wet and muddy. Lucy's dictionary got wet too. The pages were all ruined. Lucy and Max were sad because they couldn't learn any more words from the wet dictionary. They went home with the bad ending to their day, hoping for better luck next time.

He wanted to grab it and make a wish.He climbed a tree and reached out for the star, but it was too far away. So he started to cry.Suddenly, Jack had an idea. He tore off a piece of his shirt and started to swing it back and forth. The star got closer and closer. He grabbed the star and held it tightly in his hand.Jack made a wish and smiled. Then he put the star back in the sky and went home.

Story: Once upon a time there was a little black kitten. He was very stubborn and always wanted his own way. One day the little kitten saw a big grey rabbit. The kitten wanted to race the rabbit. He ran up to the rabbit and asked, "Come on, let's race!" The rabbit shook his head and said, "No, I don't feel like it." But the little black kitten wouldn't take no for an answer. He kept asking the rabbit to race him and got so angry when the rabbit wouldn't. Finally, after much pleading, the rabbit agreed to race the kitten.The race began and the little black kitten was determined to win but despite his best efforts, the rabbit was faster. The kitten reached the finish line just a few seconds behind the rabbit. Even though the kitten didn't win, he was very proud of himself for racing the rabbit. The little black kitten had learned a valuable lesson- even though he is stubborn, he can still be brave.
Summary: A stubborn little black kitten wanted to race a big grey rabbit, despite the rabbit's initial refusal. After much pleading, the rabbit agreed to race the kitten, and the kitten was proud of himself for being brave and determined, even though he didn't win.
Story: Tim and Sam were brothers who liked to play with cars. They had many cars of different colors and sizes. But Tim wanted to have all the cars for himself. He did not like to share with Sam. He was greedy and mean.One day, Tim saw a new car in the toy store. It was red and shiny and had a loud horn. He wanted it very much. He asked his mom to buy it for him, but she said no. She said he had enough cars and he should be happy with what he had. Tim was angry and sad. He decided to take the car without paying. He thought no one would see him.But he was wrong. A man who worked in the store saw him. He called the police. The police came and took Tim away. They put him in a small room with bars. It was a jail. Tim was scared and sorry. He wished he had listened to his mom. He wished he had been nice to Sam.Sam was worried about Tim. He missed his brother. He wanted to play with him. He asked his mom if they could go and see Tim. She said yes. They went to the jail and talked to Tim through a glass. Tim cried and said he was sorry. He said he learned his lesson. He said he would never steal again. He said he would share his cars with Sam. He said he loved him.Sam smiled and said he loved him too. He said he forgave him. He said he would accept him as his brother no matter what. He said he hoped they could go home soon. He said he had a surprise for him. He said he had bought the red car with his own money. He said he wanted to give it to Tim as a gift. He said he wanted to make him happy.Tim was shocked and happy. He could not believe Sam was so kind and generous. He thanked him and hugged him. He said he did not deserve such a gift. He said he would give him half of his cars. He said he wanted to be a regular brother. He said he wanted to play with him.The mom was proud and happy. She saw that Tim had changed. She saw that Sam had a big heart. She saw that they loved each other. She hoped that they would stay that way. She hoped that they would get out of the jail soon. She hoped that they would have fun with their cars. She hoped that they would be good boys.
Summary: Tim, a greedy and mean boy, stole a new car without paying for it, but was caught and taken to jail. His brother Sam, who missed him, went to visit him and forgave him, surprising Tim with a gift of the very same red car he had stolen.

Story: Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Mark. Mark loved to play with his toy clock, because he liked to learn about time. One day, Mark's friend, Sam, came to play with him. Sam was very persistent and always wanted to play with Mark's toys."Can I play with your clock?" Sam asked Mark. Mark did not want to share his toy, but he knew that friends should share. So, he said, "Yes, you can play with it for a little bit."As Sam played with the clock, Mark felt sad. He wanted to play with his clock, too. Mark tried to think of a way to get his toy back. Then, he had an idea. He said to Sam, "Let's play a game. We can take turns with the clock. You play with it for a little while, and then I'll play with it."Sam agreed, and they took turns playing with the clock. Mark was happy that he could share his toy and still have time to play with it. In the end, Mark and Sam both had fun and learned that sharing can make playtime even better.

One day, Lily saw something adorable in the river. "Mommy, daddy, look!" she said. "There's a cute duck in the river!" Her parents looked and saw the duck too. "Oh, how adorable!" her mom said. Suddenly, the duck disappeared under the water. "Where did it go?" Lily asked. "It's okay," her dad said. "It will appear again soon." And just like that, the duck appeared again, swimming happily in the river. "Quack, quack!" it said. Lily was so happy to see the adorable duck in the river. She couldn't wait to come back and see it again.

But when the birdie went inside, it got stuck. It couldn't fly back out. It felt scared and sad. Luckily, a kind person saw the birdie and helped it return to the sky. The person closed the chimney so no other birdie would get stuck. The moral of the story is to be careful and not go into places that might be dangerous.

Story: Once upon a time there was a little girl called Sophie. She was always curious and liked to try new things.One day, Sophie arrived at a restaurant. She was excited to try some new food and see what it tasted like. When the waiter came over, Sophie's face lit up as she saw all the food on the table. He asked what she would like to have.Sophie chose the spicy dish. The waiter warned her that it may be too hot for her. Sophie said it was ok, she wanted to try it anyway. The spicy dish arrived and Sophie took one bite. She coughed and spluttered as the heat tickled her tongue. Her opinion was that it was too spicy to eat. Unfortunately, it was too late. Sophie had to go to the doctor. The spicy food had hurt her throat and she would need help to recover. The moral of the story is: always listen to what others say and don't rush, even if you want something very badly.
Summary: Sophie, a curious little girl, visited a restaurant and ordered a spicy dish despite warnings from the waiter that it might be too hot. Despite her initial enthusiasm, Sophie found the dish too spicy and had to visit the doctor, learning the lesson to always listen to others' advice and be cautious when trying new things.

He ran inside and told his mum and dad what Miss Lily had said.The family talked about it and decided that honesty is a very important thing. Story: Sara and Tom are friends. They like to play together. One day, Sara gets an invitation from Anna. Anna is having a birthday party. Sara is happy. She wants to go to the party.She tells Tom about the invitation. Tom is sad. He does not have an invitation. He wants to go to the party too. He asks Sara to take him with her. Sara says no. She says the invitation is only for her. Tom is persistent. He asks Sara again and again. He says he will be good and share his toys. Sara says no again. She says the party is only for girls. Tom is persistent. He asks Sara one more time. He says he will dress like a girl and pretend to be her sister. Sara says no for the last time. She says the party is only for Anna's friends. She says Tom is not Anna's friend. She says he is her friend.Sara goes to the party. She has fun. She eats cake and plays games. She gets a present from Anna. She says thank you. She is happy. Tom stays at home. He is bored. He has no one to play with. He is sad. He wishes he had an invitation. He wishes he was Anna's friend. He wishes he was Sara's friend. He is persistent. He decides to order a pizza. He calls the pizza place. He says he wants a large pizza with cheese and pepperoni. He says he wants it fast. He says he has money. He is happy. He waits for the pizza. He hopes Sara will come back soon. He hopes she will share the pizza with him. He hopes she will be his friend. He is persistent.
Summary: Sara goes to a birthday party with Anna, while Tom stays home and is left out of the fun. Tom is persistent in asking Sara to take him to the party, but Sara repeatedly declines, explaining that the invitation is only for Anna's friends.
Story: Mia and Ben are best friends. They play every day at the park. They like to swing, slide and run. They have a lot of fun.One day, Mia has to go to her grandma's house. She has to stay there for a week. She is sad. She will miss Ben. She gives him a big hug and says bye-bye.Ben is sad too. He will miss Mia. He does not want to play at the park alone. He stays at home and draws pictures of Mia and him. He hopes she will come back soon.At grandma's house, Mia sleeps in a fancy bed. It has pink sheets and pillows. It has a canopy with stars. Mia likes the bed, but she misses her own bed. She misses her mom and dad. She misses Ben.One night, Mia hears a drip-drip-drip. She looks up and sees a leak in the ceiling. Water is falling on her bed. She is scared. She runs to grandma and tells her. Grandma is sorry. She says the roof is old and needs to be fixed. She takes Mia to another room. She gives her a hug and a kiss. She says everything will be okay.Mia feels better. She thinks of Ben. She wonders if he is okay. She wishes she could talk to him. She hopes he does not forget her. She hopes he does not find a new friend. She hopes he still likes her. She hopes he will be happy to see her when she comes back. She closes her eyes and dreams of him.
Summary: Mia and Ben are best friends who play together at the park, but Mia has to go to her grandma's house for a week and misses Ben. Ben is sad without Mia and misses her, but he stays home and draws pictures of her and hopes she will come back soon.
Story: Once upon a time there was a girl called Jessie. Every day Jessie wanted to go to the store. She put on her purple shoes and off she went.When Jessie got to the store she saw something very weird. It was an orange frog hopping around the aisles and singing. Jessie couldn't believe her eyes."What are you doing here?" Jessie asked the frog.The frog hopped around a little longer and then stopped to answer, "I'm here to find something special!"Jessie wasn't sure what to do next. Then the frog spoke again, "I need some purple fruit! Can you help me?"Jessie smiled and started looking for the purple fruit in the store. Finally she found it, and happily gave it to the frog.The frog thanked Jessie, gave her a big hug and hopped away. Jessie couldn't help but laugh - it was the weirdest thing she had ever seen!
Summary: Jessie went to the store and saw an orange frog hopping around and singing. The frog asked Jessie for help finding purple fruit, and Jessie happily helped him, resulting in the frog thanking her and giving her a hug before hopping away.
